Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION- GREAT ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: maggiemoo19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and is perfect when you have children esp if you would like extra rooms for them to sleep in. Do be aware though that if you are driving and wish to park around the hotel it costs 15euro for 1 day. I have no bad words to say about the hotel - just stay there. Stay are lovely and the hotel is ver modern and chic. We stayed for easter and every room recieved a bag of easter eggs - nice touch :)

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and comfortable, great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: daddyrib
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights from the 5th April 2012. We had a one bedroom apartment. What a treat. Absolutely immaculate. Comes with Fridge (and small freezer), washing machine, CD/Radio system, tumble dryer, dishwasher, halogen oven/microwave,two ring halogen cooker, two flat screen TV's (lounge and bedroom) choice of channels a bit poor, usual news only, but plenty of buy it films and saucy ones too. Most importantly, bathroom was immaculate, good water pressure, plenty of hot water, and plenty of towels. Room service was every day, cleaned and freshened, bedding change every 3 days, but more often if requested.The apartment was spacious and tastefully decorated, air conditioning was efficient and virtually silent. So far So good. Front desk staff were very welcoming and helpful, multi-lingual, which really helps as I guess, like most Brits (to my shame), I hardly speak any other language than English. Not sure that the breakfast was value for money, it appeared to be 19euros a head, which we thought was a bit steep. So we never used the restaurant and as such cant make a comment on that. However, there is a couple of supermarkets within a couple of minutes where we just stocked up. the apartments building also had a small swimming pool and spa bath, and a sauna in the basement, all very clean. The apartments were close to Check Point Charlie just on the old eastern side of the Berlin Wall, and within a five minute walk of Stradmitte Underground train station. All other sites to see were really easily accessible using the public transport system, which we got the hang of in the first day. If we can do that, then anyone can, believe me. If your a sight seer, then get a "Welcome to Berlin" card, it costs around 36euros for 5 days, but means that all public transport is paid, and it also gives you a genuine 25% discount on virtually every paying sight, boat trip, walking tour, etc etc. We did two walking tours with "Insider Tours" (meets near Berlin Zoo, easy to find), absolutely recommend these costs about 12 euros with the discount, and lasts for about 4 - 6 hours. Along with all the other historical stuff on offer, well enjoy it, but leave some time to visit Berlin Zoo, you'll be glad you did. They have set it up in such a way, that you are virtually on the same level as the animals, without any intrusive fences etc to spoil the view. Would we recommend the Adina Apts ....Yes Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “A Homerun!”
Reviews.Author: SDMom1
Reviews.Content: My husband and three children stayed at the Adina Checkpoint Charlie for two nights and it amazing. The pool and sauna, the HUGE room, the hotel's excellent location, and most importantly, the friendly, helpful, and professional staff at the Hotel Adina Checkpoint Charlie are all reasons to recommend this fabulous hotel. The hotel is beautifully decorated and very clean. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant but we did have a drink there before dinner and the ambiance is warm and inviting. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vltoghill
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just returned from a trip to Berlin where we stayed at the Adina Apartments at Checkpoint Charlie. The hotel was everything we could have hoped for, we opted for an apartment hotel to give us a bit more space as we were in the city for five days. The room was spacious and the kitchen area well equipped with cooking utensils, microwave (with grill) kettle and toaster. The staff were all very pleasant and attentive and their English was excellent (the same can be said for most Berliners -it really puts the Brits to shame!) The swimming pool looked very nice although we didn't use it as the water felt a little cool. The location was about 5/10 mins from the underground which was really handy to get about on. The bar has happy hour daily which was the way we started every evening :) the wine was very good! We didn't eat diner at the restaurant instead opting for local restaurants of which there were many. The Chinese and Irish Pub across the road were both good as was the Italian near Checkpoint Charlie. The breakfast buffet was very well stocked, would definitely return if we found ourselves back in Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very professional and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: joepapa251
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with the professional and friendly service provided by the staff at Adina hotel. The apartment was everything I could of wanted for comfort , cleanliness , quiet and discreet attention form the staff. Beautiful, tastefull interior,attention to detail. An extra pleasure to enjoy the hotels pool , sauna and bubble bath! I look forward to returning to Adina Hotel to enjoy a relaxing vacation in Berlin. thank you for a great visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Good self catering option”
Reviews.Author: caramck
Reviews.Content: Recently enjoyed a 3 night stay, good location, very clean, quite rooms and good price. Self catering option good as supermarker accross the road (handy for supplies). Found bed somewhat hard, and I forgot my adaptor and according to hotel they could be borrowed, however both myself and another room who had also forgotten theirs could not borrow one as the hotel did not have any. Other than this small matter I would recommend the Adina, PS if you could fix your illuminated sign as some of the letters are not lit up and it is a handy marker when locating the hotel in the dark. Ciara, Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MuMWien
Reviews.Content: As already done previously, my husband and me we stayed in the Adina for three nights. There cannot be any complaint: central location (Gendarmenmarkt nicest place of Berlin to be said only 5 minutes), very close to a shop for renting cheap bicycles (we definitely recommend discovering Berlin by bike), very friendly staff, General Manager takes personally care of his guests, clean rooms with a lot of space, light and comfort. Price is adequately. For food we did not try, but the excellent wine list. However, Berlin offers so many resutaurants (also close to the hotel) so that we do not think it is necessary to stay for dinner in the hotel. Excellent hotel we definitely will choose again coming soon back to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie03041952
Reviews.Content: found the Adina to be a really nice hotel. Could not ask for anything better as far as being close to all the places to go. We found the whole concept of an apartment hotel to be really good. Staff were so friendly and the breakfast most enjoyable. Would stay here again if we return to Berlin which we will

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: Clausch2010
Reviews.Content: The Adina hotel is a nice hotel and very good option for those traveling with family. Very friendly staff. They should have 24 hours room service and more TV Channels options

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rob_M_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Adina Checkpoint Charlie for 4 weeks in February 2012 whilst on business in Berlin. My apartment was really large and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean and modern but the shower wasn't great (not enough water pressure). The staff on the front desk were very helpful and friendly, as were the staff in the restaurant. The food in the restaurant is OK but not amazing. The location is great, 5 mins walk from either Spittelmarkt or Stadtmitte U-bahn stations. It's a quiet area so you won't have any trouble with noise. It is on a street that is a bit dark at night though, and feels a bit out of the way. The swimming pool and sauna were nice to have and although I didn't use it the gym looked well kitted out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 1poser1 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay in the Adina Checkpoint Charlie Hotel, the rooms were just like home, the location was excellent with Checkpoint Charlie round the corner and most of the other attractions within walking distance. We would stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: margieireland
Reviews.Content: just returned from Berlin short break, stayed at this fantastic hotel,really clean hotel with large apartment style rooms. We were very impressed with all the amenities and also with all the staff. Food was excellent and hotel was in a great location,would definitely recommend it,I really couldnt find any fault with it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 475S_ren_I
Reviews.Content: Very large, clean rooms. Nice staff. We stayed in a 2 room apartment with both dishwasher, hotplates, microwave oven and a nice big refrigerator. The rooms are very soundproof which is a good thing when you're traveling with small children.

Reviews.Title: “warm and stylish”
Reviews.Author: wolfgang3633
Reviews.Content: whenever in berlin i stay at the adina which became our favorit since it is open. if we stay longer in a place i prefere the space and the possibility of self catering of an apartment combined with the possibilitys a hotel is offering. adina managed to fullfil this very well and in an australien easy going athmosphaere.modern and still warm design throughout the house.quite a number of australiens on the staff side always open for small talk. location in a side street in center of new berlin good possibilitys to park at the road or the garage garage should be booked in advance since there are only 15 to 20 parkingnlots.rooms to the streets i prefervto the in house hof.top floor is the best. restaurant is ok and offers a small card ,bar is fine.anyway in berlin one goes out for dinner to one of the 1000 restaurants around all in all adina is good and you can choose anyone of the 3 in berlin.more livly is the gendarmenmarkt one which i stayed as well

Reviews.Title: “Freedom and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Leeark
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself visited Berlin from March 5 to 8 2012. We booked the Adina on line. We were really pleased with our choice. The staff were excellent. Our German was very poor but they had great English and were most helpful and friendly at all times. The Apartment was one bedroomed, very spacious and well equipped as well as being spotless. While you have the freedom in the Apartment you also have the hotel facilities like the swimming pool. We also got very good advices from the young people at reception. The foyer was most welcoming. While we are unlikely to be back in Berlin we will be looking out for Adina Apartment Hotels in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit Berlin”
Reviews.Author: travelbelgium
Reviews.Content: Went here on a business trip. Very large, clean rooms, or suites, good breakfast with plenty of choice. Pleasant staff. Location is good if your focus is on East Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: kkatty1
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in the adina for 5 nights during february.It is a really beautiful hotel with rooms which are very spacious clean and modern. the breakfast was very nice , it was included in our room rate, but i think that 19,50 euros per person would be to much to pay for it, so watch out for a rate including breakfast. The pool sauna jacuzzi area was great to relax after a day out in the streets of berlin. There were two metro stations only a five to seven minute walk away and the shopping area of Friedrichstr. was close enough to walk there(approx. 10 min) The staff was polite and helpful when asked. All in all it was a great stay and I would definitely recommend it to anybody. The only thing that might have made it better would be a free wifi internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and luxury in Mitte.”
Reviews.Author: DrJ-62
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel offers the perfect base for visiting Berlin for business or pleasure. Spacious, clean, smartly appointed, quiet, and featuring well-supplied kitchens - this was a real apartment. I plan to stay again next year when attending the Berlinale.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin's Mitte district”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: room was large and comfortable with a nice bathroom and firm, comfortable matress. I found the staff to be friendly and polite. There are plenty of coffee shops in the neighborhood close enough to everything that a short walk got me where I wanted to go

Reviews.Title: “Nice duds, well-located for tourists”
Reviews.Author: ShawnBToronto
Reviews.Content: Adina is located near Checkpoint Charlie and the other touristy spots, which is good for the average traveler into that. Personally, I like East Berlin a lot more for it's creativity and youthful energy, so I'd stay in that locale. However, the hotel itself is great. The apartment-style rooms were spacious, nicely appointed and had little balconies and kitchens with the tools that you need to actually use it. There is also a grocery store nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well equipped hotel”
Reviews.Author: AandA2003
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in an apartment hotel and we were very impressed. We had a 1 bedroom apartment with excellent quality furnishings, very spacious and exceptionally well equipped and clean, almost tempting enough to stay in every night! The only gripe was the curtains, which didn't quite fit the full width of the windows in the bedroom or living area. We didn't manage to find time to visit the pool or sauna but did spend time in the bar enjoying the happy hour cocktails before we ventured out for dinner. Bar staff were friendly and attentive and the cocktails generously sized. The decor and fittings throughout were well maintained and modern and if back in Berlin wewould definitely try and stay here again or in the other Berlin branch. Well worth a look. There is a decent supermarket Kaisers round the corner on Leipziger St and you're within 10 minutes walk of Stadtmitte and Hausvogteiplatz U-Bahn stations so not far from most attractions - although we walked everywhere easily - and it's around 20minutes by taxi (EURO20) to/from Tegel Airport.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for family with young kids”
Reviews.Author: DrillCat
Reviews.Content: I love renting a car in Germany. German autobahn is one of my passion. That being said, you need a car in order to be comfortable in a large city such as Berlin. Adina is my favorite hotel in Germany. I have stayed at its Berlin, Frankfurt and Hamburg locations with my family of 5. Extremely clean, tastefully appointed and large for European standard. The car park under the building is a bit small and may require few attemps to get your car out but it is expected. Its location might be a challenge if you have to walk everywhere as it is not really that close to main attractions. But then again, Berlin is vast and there really isn't any PERFECT location for hotel. The front office people are somewhat mechanical but efficient. The rooms are very comfortable with a small kitchen. Refrigerator and washer and dryer. Having 3 kids, Adina offers the most bang for the buck! Cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Britishgoabroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 while visiting the Christmas markets. It was excellent. We were really impressed with the size of the room, there was a king size bed, a nice lounge area away from the bedroom and then a little kitchenette which had everything we needed. The place was clean and very quiet. We used the pool and sauna which were both nice, the pool is narrow so choose your time wisely many more than 4 people and it would be crowded. The location was great too, easy walking distance from many sights and lots of good restaurants. We took the train from Schoenefeld Airport to Alexanderplatz and just walked which isn't too far if you're travelling light! (or take a metro a bit closer). We would definitely stay here again and at other Adina Apartment hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good spacious apartment at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: engam
Reviews.Content: This is my second experience staying in Adina hotel in Berlin. The first was with Adina Haupbanorf. I had a one bedroom apartment facing the courtyard. It was very quiet. The unit was spacious and modern, with Australian aboriginal paintings on the walls. I couldn't fault any of the facilities, except the internet access which continued to be a problem for me and could be a deal breaker in my next visit to Berlin. The charges of 15 euro a day is considered on the high side at a time when most hotels are offering free internet acess. You would expect fast download speed when you had been asked to pay for the service, but both the wifi and cable speed were miserably slow, the download speed was typically around 1 KB/S, hardly enough to do any video viewing. I ate a couple of times in the restaurant. The food was ok, but the serving portion was small leaving me feeling hungry after a 3 course dinner. I have later discovered and ate in a Chinese restaurant in the neighbourhood with reasonable price and good food. Having said that, if you are just after a clean, quiet room to close your eyes in a central location, and don't use the internet much, then this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A top-notch apartment”
Reviews.Author: seagenga
Reviews.Content: We were staying at "Adina" at the turn of December 2011/January 2012. The apartment consisted of a spacious living room (combined with a kitchen) and a fairly big bedroom. The kitchen was superbly equipped with everything one could possibly imagine, including a fridge and a dishwasher. The bathroom included both a washing machine and a dryer (washing powder was provided for some small fee). We could also treat ourselves to a selection of snacks and drinks -- they were not for free but it was good to have them at hand. The only (negligible) disadvantages we experienced were the following: (1) one had to pay for using the wireless net (2) dinners offered by the hotel restaurant were almost exclusively meat-based (breakfast, though a bit expensive, were perfectly fine in this respect) Apart from that, everything else was top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: piggyLondon
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Adina - staff friendly and helpful - location is great. Two guys stayed in one of the apartment rooms which were better equipped than my home. Pillows and bedlinen fantastic - was big enough for us both to have our own space. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “The Best way to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: SusanneTD
Reviews.Content: Adina Apartments is new, modern, clean and great service! The apartments and space in the room was huge... Its also very close to all the great sites in Berlin. Rent a bike near by, and cruise your way to lovely coffeshops and shopping. <3 Stay at the Adnia, and have a wonderful weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “A great way to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: spems22
Reviews.Content: Howcome I never thought of booking an appartement before? Why staying on a cramped hotelroom where you can barely move your reasonable sized derriere in? At Adina, we found a great way to stay. A nice, spaceous appartment with an all-in kitchen, a nice bathroom with a bath and a large bedroom, for a very appropriate price ánd all the comfort and service of a hotelroom. There's an inhouse parking for your car, a fitness, sauna, small but comfortable swimming pool and a whirlpool. Yay! There's wifi in the whole hotel and the connection is stable. You pay almost 15 euro's, for 24 hours of wifi. That seems expensive, but it's for the 24 hours you actually use, not 'for a period of...'. So that's an okay price, right? :-) The Adina is quite a new hotel with a nice ambiance and tasteful design. The staff is friendly, helpfull and know their way around the city. The only thing why I didn't give 5 points is the fact that the location is not THAT near at Checkpoint Charlie nor near any U-bahn/S-bahn. It still takes a 10/15 minutes walk to Stadtmitte or Hausvogteiplatz. But if you don't mind a nice walk and like a more quiet and relaxing location, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LLMM0208
Reviews.Content: Lovely apartments which were modern, clean and centrally located. You can reach all the sites of Berlin from here and the hotel also offers a great restaurant. The room was well equipped if you needed to cook something but we chose the hotel for the size of the room and location. I can see how everyone rated this so highly - thoroughly recommend it to all - families or couples exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for an extended stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dsam-melb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Checkpoint Charlie for 5 nights in a 1 bedroom apartment. Firstly, the apartment we stayed in on the 4th floor was great, quite large, and clean and tidy. Actually, from the hotel perspective, I really only have good things to say. The staff were helpful and friendly... there was a problem with the Wifi after the first day, but we were given "visitor" wifi vouchers to see us through which was great. The location is OK - it's a good 5-10 min walk to either a u-bahn station or the closest restaurant area. This was fine for us, but reading some of the other reviews it may not be to everyones liking. Yes - the website says there is a gym, but it is really a cardio room only. Don't expect to be able to do any serious training. There is a pay-per-use gym though about 5 mins walk though. And there is a supermarket less than 5 mins away which is very handy. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location. Substandard rooms”
Reviews.Author: BethShan42
Reviews.Content: Off the back of tripadvisor reviews we stayed at the Adina on our recent visit to Berlin. It's the first time I've been let down by the recommendations. Let's start with the location. It's in a depressingly bleak street surrounded by crumbling high rises and right next to a main road. Cross the main road and the streets are nicer, as are the hotels. Why oh why didn't I stay there. The Adina itself was also a disappointment. I normally stay with them when travelling in Australia. I had high expectations which were not met: - We asked for a non smoking room but got smoking. - The surface of the cupboards had a thick layer of dust, so we had to clean it ourselves. - The kettle was full of grime and peeling plastic. We had to use a pot to boil our water. - The food in the Alto restaurant was very average. They try but fail at attempting Australian cuisine. Too fussy and stodgy. - Reception recommended the supermarket around the corner for groceries. Don't bother. Hardly any stock. Not even cereal. Walk an extra 5-10mins to Leipzigerstrasse (near Friedrichstrasse) to a bigger supermarket called Kaiser. On the positive, it forced us to look further afield for good food and coffee. The Barn on Augustrasse (near Hackeschermkt) serves beautiful coffee, cakes and light lunch. Very cool area, small cobbled streets. We also discovered a wonderful deli on Friedrichstrasse called Linder. Homemade cakes, salads, charcuterie etc to die for. Stock up and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a fascinating city: Hotel and City Review”
Reviews.Author: collis5
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 3 nights last week and had an enjoyable stay. Flights to and from L/pool on Easyjet were excellent although parts of Speke and Schoenfeld Airport are in need of refurbishment. The Adina hotel is not! It's immaculate, modern and welcoming. The only thing it's missing is a jacuzzi in the 'spa' and a bath in our room , both would have helped rest our weary legs! The bar was cosy and reasonably priced The hotel is in a safe quiet location but within easy reach of most major sites. My favourites were the Jewish Museum ( need 3-4 hrs to do it justice), Gendarmenmarkt (Beautuiful square) , Hackesche Hoffe (the 8 courtyards are secreted way but are stunning) and the Reichststag. I'd not had confirmation back that we'd been given a tour slot for the visit to the parliament building (book it a week before you go) so we turned up 'blind', It was a great feeling to see our names on the list and be guided through the slick security, be handed free audio guides and entry to the glass dome (Like charlie and the choc factory but without the chocolate!). The dome is stunning and offers great views of the city Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Topog of Terrors and the Holocaust museum are all must sees but it's easy to overdo the sightseeing and not take enough time out to relax and peoplewatch. The sony centre and Potsdamer Platz are worth a visit. It was extremely cold when were there so we took 'shelter' in the Ritz Carlton which is worth a visit if you want to see opulence! As is a vist to K De Werte dept store near Kurfurstendamm where the food hall and winter gardens on floors 6 and 7 are worth a vist if you are a foodie! Couple of restaurants worth a mention are Vapino (Italian) and Auigustine (German resturant off Frederichstrasse, near Gendarmenmarkt

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: jelby1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Adina Hotel was perfect from start to finish. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment which included dishwasher, washing machone and tumble dryer. The kitchen was well equipped & it was nice to have the option of preparing our own breakfasts. The apartment itself was very spacious, clean & well presented. We also found the staff on reception to be very helpful, giving directions and offering advice on the best places to go out shopping, restaurants, bars etc... The hotel is in a quiet residential area but is only a short walk from the nearest U-bahn & shopping district with Checkpoint Charlie just minutes away. Our stay here was incredibly enjoyable & incredible value, I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “First class stay!”
Reviews.Author: TwinknChumb
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with adjacent apartment to friends. Impeccable apartment in a quiet location central to many places of interest. Near to u-Bahn, but walkable to many places. Very cosy décor. Staff made us welcome and were very accommodating. Nice meal in restaurant. Despite being a little on the pricey side (which seems fairly normal in Berlin), the wine was very good. Can’t fault the hotel. Would definitely stay again for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel complimented by fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyRobbo
Reviews.Content: Only thing bad I could say is that the mini bar is waaay overpriced. Nearly €4 for a bottle of water :-\

Reviews.Title: “Great place - would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: space_29
Reviews.Content: Great three night break. Got upgraded to a one bed apartment from a studio. Room beautifully furnished and very well equipped (kitchen, fridge, two tvs, stereo, washer/dryer etc). We wish we had taken our swim suits as there is a pool and whirlpool in the basement. Great location 2 minutes walk from the u-barn which is on the main line between Potzdam Plaza and Alexander Platz. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Hkj00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my husband in October 2011. It was great! We had a 1 bedroom apartment. Great living area with little balcony. A huge plus was the washing machine and dryer. Could have lived here a month! It was perfect to have extra space as my sister was getting married in Berlin. We got ready in this apartment and plenty of room for family photos and champagne before the ceremony! It's close to train station and key attractions. A very quiet hotel, unlike other places I stayed in Europe. I love this hotel. I hope I can visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: neroskelmorlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights recently with my husband and 14 year old daughter. Exccellent location. Within walking distance of all main attractions. 5 mins from Checkpoint Charlie, Unter den Linden. Gendenmarkt etc. Apartment has everything you need. I asked for quiet apt on top floor and got just that. No noise at all from other rooms. Staff were very helpful and friendly. As a history teacher the Topographie of Terror display and the remnant of the Wall beside it (just along from Checkpoint Charlie) were excellent and FREE. Checkpoint Charlie museum is great but 12.50 Euros per adult!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartments in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SammyHo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights recently, upgrade on arrival helped paint the picture. Appartment was excellent with great facilties, clean and very spacious. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Location close to U-Bahn at Stadmitte and Spittel Market which allowed easy access to anywhere in Berlin. Would definately stay again if in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LoisOttawa
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here October 1-6th. Booked a Premier one bedroom apt. and were delighted with the space,the cleanliness and the much needed washer/dryer. We love to walk and had no difficulty getting to the Brandenburg Gate, Potsdamer Platz,and Museum Island,not to mention Checkpoint Charlie. Gendarmenmarkt is nearby. As previous reviewers mentioned,there is a grocery store around the corner and a smaller store down the street if you chose to make your own breakfast or lunch, as we did. The front desk staff were all very helpful,especially when I had trouble getting my iPad connected to their WiFi. It would have been nice to have free WiFi,but if you remember to log off after each use it won't cost too much ( I think it was around 3 Euros for 3 hours). Highly recommend this hotel. It is quiet and we had great sleeps here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Marcelo C
Reviews.Content: We, me and my wife, stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in out/2011. The room was perfect, nice kitchen with utensilies, nice bathroom, big desktable, excelent living room in suite, everything fine. To things be better only if the internet would be free of charge and the price of breakfast(if you want to use the hotel's restaurant) could be more accessible. The staff was perfect too. We love Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: SVNLK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property for a very short trip to Berlin for business. I was a bit concerned about a previous review that said it was "a bit off the beaten path" but we found it an excellent location. We had a 1 bedroom suite, very spacious, clean and comfortable w/a full kitchen. Large bathroom with tub/shower and a great towel warmer. We were at the front of the building, and as another reviewer noted, it can be noisy as the street in front of the building is busy. Front desk staff were fantastic and when we asked for a couple of things they were delivered to our room immediately. Good suggestions for local/walking distance restaurants, tourist sites, and help w/transportation. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant - only one morning for breakfast. The 19euro price is a bit steep and there are several small cafes w/in a few minutes that provide a better value. We did not need to use public transportation, but saw metro stops about a 5 minute walk away from the hotel. Easy walk to all that this 'Mitte' section of old Berlin has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Fault! Absolutely Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Emwa90
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing stay at Adina Hotel in Berlin. Our room was spacious, modern and very clean. The restaurant downstairs was fantastic. Particularly enjoyed their breakfast; we got specially ordered eggs each morning with our meals (no extra charge!). The service was fantastic, very hard to fault. Only wish we'd brought our bathers so we could swim in the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina M
Reviews.Content: These apartments are fabulous, a home from home. A large spacious living area with everything you could ever want, tasteful decor with an Australian/Aboriginal feel. A well stocked fridge, spotlessly clean you couldn't ask for more. Good location with everything within a 5/10 minute walk. Great restaurants close by. 5*****

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Wonderful. Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: Great rooms. Great apartments. Great staff. Great location (a bit of a walk to the train station though). All the little things in the apartment were there, for example, provided dishwasher tablets or washing powder. Just a wonderful place to stay really and we'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Our introduction to the Adina brand and would recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: Mitch-n-Greg
Reviews.Content: I especially liked that while we were very close to Checkpoint Charlie and Gendarmarkt, we were on a quiet street without traffic. There is a very convenient supermarket on Leipzigerstrasse, and the hotel is within a 7-10 minute walk to three subway stops (Stadtmitte, Hausvogteiplatz and Spittelmarkt) and a 3-minute walk to the M48 bus, so nothing ever felt too far away. Potsdamerplatz and Museum Island are only a 5 minute ride away. The facility was very well-kept; we opted for a studio facing Krausenstrasse. Again, no noise. The room was very comfortable: comfortable bed, good water pressure, good sized fridge, toaster, coffemaker. The pool and spa were kept in good shape, and the small gym was much better-equipped than I'd expected. Nearby restaurants that I'd recommend are Entrecote (French), Good Time (Thai) and Brasserie Am Gendarmenmarkt (French/eclectic). The concert house is about a ten-minute walk; Galeries Lafayette about 15 minutes. If staying in Hamburg or Copenhagen, I would absolutely consider staying at another Adina hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin excellent apartment hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maxglenn
Reviews.Content: Really good two bedroomed apartment, great kitchen, everything provided, kitchen utensils,micrwave,toaster etc., even provided with dishwasher, washer and dryer.Areas all very clean and tidy. All in all excellent three nights spent here with my wife and son. Not far away from shops, underground, buses etc. Well satisfied with the hotel, would go again no problem, and Berlin was an excellent choice of destination.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, one issue”
Reviews.Author: derob
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for a single night. Hotel is situated in residential area, approx 7 minutes from nearest metro station. Room however was excellent value, large with comfortable bed. The very small kitchen (microwave only) could be added value during a longer stay. Particularly since the breakfast is pricey, albeit good. I would defenitely advise this place if you are for business in Berlin for a week or longer. The one issue was the plugged shower, that turned the whole bathroom into a swimming pool. When I had entered I noticed the floor was not fully clean, which will have been caused by the same problem. The hotel therefore must have been aware, and should have solved. The bathroom became pretty much unusable, but was partly substituted by the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: edel14
Reviews.Content: Great appartment. When we checked in we were upgraded from studio to one bed appartment. Great appartment, plasma TV's, lovely kitchen and nice seated area. Hotel staff helpful and polite. Hotel resturant was great. Food and staff brilliant. Would suggest you make your own breakfast, supermarket just 250-300 meters away. Or eat ot as we did we bought coffee for 99c and croissants also very reasonable. Only downside was the location of hotel down a quiet residential and not well lit uo at night street. however we would stay at hotel again and recommend it to friends. suggest you try a Cosmopolitan or two in the evening from bar. just perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way but great service and near Gendarmenmarkt”
Reviews.Author: glunardi
Reviews.Content: The only minor thing is that this apartment hotel is a bit out of the way. Otherwise kudos to everything I tried. The kitchen was nicely furnished (it even had a kettle which is important to me). There is a little convenience store 250 meters/yards on the same street. Bed was comfortable, Shower as well. The staff was great attentive and prompt. I checked in under 5 minutes, borrowed an umbrella within 10 seconds, was told how to print my 2 page documents under 2 minutes, got good dinner recommendations and directions. Particularly liked the fact that the staff is not afraid to suggest that you walk places. I walked to Friedchistrass train station everyday and it was great (around 15 minutes). That gave me a direct connection to the ICC Messe Berlin. The wireless Internet is not the fastest (priced for 3 hours, 12 hours or 24 hours) I think. Given the price of the room I paid, with the Internet charge it was still a fraction of the other places I was looking at. Highly recommended if you are not afraid to not be in the center of the action. Great comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Mike186299
Reviews.Content: I staid here with my wife and 2 hrs old daughter. We booked an apartment room. It consisted of a kitchenette bathroom bedroom and living area. The kitchenette was very clean with sink oven microwave etc.. In the bathroom hidden in a cupboard was a washing machine and dryer. As far as our room was concerned we could not have been happier. There is a nice pool and gym area in the basement and the bar/ Resturant was really good with buy one free drinks between 5 &7. The only negative thing I will say about our time is that although we were advised upon booking that check in was 2 we were kept waiting for well over an hour before our room was available. As far as location is concerned you are about a 10 minute walk from check point Charlie and I guess 25-30 minutes from unter den linden. We really enjoyed our time here and will be back next time we go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Top class facilities”
Reviews.Author: firbolg
Reviews.Content: The rooms/apartments are very spacious indeed and furnished to an exceptionally high quality for a reasonable price. Staff are very helpful and the breakfast facilities are pretty decent. Location might seem a little off the beaten track but it's right beside a u-bahn station that will connect to you to pretty much anywhere else in the city within a 15min trip.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin is a great city to visit”
Reviews.Author: IndiaOC
Reviews.Content: Weather was great, Hotel was great, boutique and really nice. Lots of room. Kitchenette. The staff was very helpful and I rented a bike and saw the city. (Although I was there for work). Definitely recommended and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good aparthotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: Daria19
Reviews.Content: Good breakfasts! Nice and comfortable rooms, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn,t fault it !”
Reviews.Author: LeeCanberra
Reviews.Content: Quiet street, comfortable, clean rooms, nice decor. Breakfast variety excellent, staff are friendly and helpful. Couldn,t fault it at all. Location is great, being in a quiet street but minutes away from the excitement of Checkpoint Charlie, loads of restaurants and large supermarket in next street under the flats. Thourghly enjoyed my stay there and would recommend it to anyone, families, singles or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartments!”
Reviews.Author: colin b
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Adina Apartments from the 19th to 22nd of august. Was very surprised to see how nice the hotel was. The reception was beatiful, the courtyard even more so and the restaurant was very busy.. unfortunately we never ate there but the prices looked reasonable and menu looked great to. The rooms are brilliant. They come with everything you could ever need. Full kitchen with every kind of utensil you could want, dishwasher, microwave too. 2 tv's - one in sitting room and one in the bedroom. stereo with cd player, washing machine dryer. Nice shower, blow dryer.. literally the room had everything!! And the beds were amazingly comfortable as well. The only issue i would have would be the staff - While they were helpfull and very well mannered they weren't "German-ly efficient". I had ordered flowers and champagne upon arrival through e-mail which was acknowledged by them. they quoted the price 60 euro which i agreed. When we arrived (3 hours before check in) i asked about the flowers and they had no idea what i was talkin about so i we had to sort everything out again (while trying to discreetly fool the other half). I was told it would take an extra hour after check in to get this done. So paid with my debit card. We returned a half hour early as we were sweaty and tired from travelling all day. At the check in i asked why i had paid an extra 150 and was told it wasnt paid it was just reserved with for that amount. There was a lot of back and forward and i ended up giving them my card again and they tried to bill me a second time. I took my card back and rang my bank who explained the money is gone through to the hotel. I returned and explained what my bank had said and after repeating what was happening about 5 times the receptionist finally understood. This whole incident left me embarrassed and highly annoyed. We went to our room and were told the bags would be brought up and the flowers shortly after. after 45 mins there were still no sign of the bags. I got annoyed and went to walk out the door to bring the bags up myself and there was one of the staff standing there with flowers.. so that was the surprise ruined. She came in and placed the flowers on the table along with the champagne.. but only brought 1 glass and half the luggage. This wasn't a good start to our time here Other than that incident i found our stay to be great and would love to return again as the rooms really were the best i have ever stayed in. the hotel was close to all the tourists spots as well as only a U-bahn journey away from anything else!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Hikusu-san
Reviews.Content: We chose the Adina Apartment Hotel near Checkpoint Charlie partly for its location and partly because, as vegetarians in a city devoted to its different forms of wurst, we thought we might need to do some cooking for ourselves! Right from our arrival to the moment we left, the staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Our studio apartment had everything we needed, including a cooker, microwave, dishwasher, washing machine, tumble dryer, hair dryer, iron & ironing board! Plus the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. It was great to have a separate bedroom and living area. The decor was as though the apartment had just been decorated, and the level of cleanliness throughout our stay was superb. Our room was cleaned and tidied every day, the toiletries were replenished regularly. It really felt like a home away from home. We found the location to be perfect - really handy for the U-bahn, and within walking distance of Checkpoint Charlie, the Gendarmenmarkt, shopping on Franzoischestrasse and Unter den Linden, and the preserved section of Wall at Wilhelmstrasse. It was handy to be able to buy the Berlin Welcome Card at the hotel, and we made good use of it, using the U-Bahn, S-Bahn and buses, as well as getting discounts in museums we visited. We would definitely stay there again, and are thinking about using the Adina Apartment Hotel if we visit Copenhagen, we enjoyed our Berlin stay so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment/hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: RustyRobbins
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and really couldn't fault the hotel at all. Facilities are fabulous and staff generally friendly and helpful. Oh, and no naked men in the sauna when I was in there! :-/

Reviews.Title: “A FABULOUS WELCOME TO GERMANY”
Reviews.Author: AFM20
Reviews.Content: Congratulations to general manager Dirk Loeb who has pulled together a team of professional, informed and friendly ambassadors to both Germany and the Adina chain. It was my 1st visit to Berlin and I came away relieved to have found the hotel. In fact it was so pleasant we extended our stay! The staff at check - in were quick to respond and happy to help. In the bar they were always warm and accommodating. The standard of housekeeping was excellent. It was fabulous having wash & dry facilities in the room. The hotel is very central to both train stations and easy to walk about. Using local eateries - they were all good from the takeaway bratwurst to the 5 star. I don't think you can eat badly in Germany!

Reviews.Title: “Fina hotel - we'll loved it”
Reviews.Author: fun2fun
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, with great indoor pool. The thing we missed is smack bar. Whill beeing there we had to eat full dinner or to go out and find a retaurant near . We think that a snack bar would fullfil the need for something small and cheap. The internet connection was good (but we had to pay). the breakfat was great ! Love the hotel and will recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back, rude, substandard service, room smelly”
Reviews.Author: Birdsong2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel seems to be living off its location and competitive advantage of difficulty in finding family-sized suites in Berlin. Reception overcharged us by one night but it took two calls from two countries to get them to address the problem. Breakfast was overpriced. Am now emailing in vain, for second day, to try to get corrected receipt. Room stank of deep heat or something but too tired to complain after long drive so just lived with it. Swimming pool was cold. Staff rude about overcharge until forced to apologize for error and were far from demanding guests. Frankly felt like we were a nuisance. What a disappointment. So was looking forward to this stop.

Reviews.Title: “A great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MCZedeler
Reviews.Content: We opted for the Adina apartments because we were travelling with two kids under 4. So having a romm with bedroom you can close off and a kitchen to make dinner were major requirements for us. Adina provided all this. The room we got was a 1 bedroom with a lounge/sitting area/kitchen and balcony. In the louge a fold out coutch was turned into a bed. This all worked really well for us. The street that the hotel lies on is not that interesting but two blocks away and you are at Gendarmarkt (a very nice historic square with restaurants and cafes) and check point charlie is just around the corner. The kitchen is stoked with utencils but we did miss a frying pan and a larger tray/dish for the oven. We survived with what was available so didn'task staff if they could provide one. All and all I can say that if you want to stay in the Mitte area of Berlin then this is the place to choose. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: psuhula
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very clean, comfortable. Plenty of room. Reserved a one bedroom and loved having the washer and dryer in the room. Tea pot was a great addition. Didn't use much of the other kitchen facilities. Didn't pay for the internet but used the public computer in the lobby which was usually available for the few minutes that we needed to use it. Front desk was very helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom apartment on the corner. Lots of windows, a balcony, very roomy. 2 bathrooms is a great bonus. The kitchen is a good size with all the appliances. Great to have a washing machine and separate dryer. 1 block away there is a Lidl store where you can buy food and wine. Handy to Friedrichstrasse, the shopping precinct. Very pleased with our choice of accommodation. Like so many hotels now, they charge for each device for each day on the internet. Probably cheaper if you stay more than a couple of days to buy a Vodaphone usb stick and pay 12.95e for 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even consider! Rooms smell terrible!”
Reviews.Author: netto25
Reviews.Content: We booked in advance and when we arrived we found out that our room smells very, very badly. All carpets and curtains are impregnated with cigar smoke or something else. We called reception, they came into the room with an air freshener and said that was all they can do (politely I must say). Really? We booked a non smoking room, expecting to have the best time in the city but we can stay for more than 30 minutes inside the room. We asked to change rooms and they said they were full, meaning something like: you'll get used to it.... So we are now booking other hotel, leaving and asking for a refund. So if you are not a heavy smoker stay away from Adina hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FDMcGady
Reviews.Content: It was more then a bed and bath - we had a suite that we could really spread out in. The room was modern and clean. It's in a great location if you are interested in the history of Berlin as well as the museums. The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. You are within walking distance to some excellent restaurants around the Gendarmenmarkt. You are also withing walking distance to a U-Bahn station (Mitte) and Leipzigstrasse and the number M48 bus.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DakotaTyler
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night trip to Berlin, our first. Berlin is SUCH an amazing city (rivals Paris in my book) and our stay at this Adina only helped to enhance the experience. First of all, the location was perfect. It's between the Spittelmart and Stadmitte U-bahn stations, a 10 minute walk from either one. If you are coming from the airport make sure you have an up to date map. Ours was a bit out of date and we took the wrong trains, adding about an hour to our trip. But it's easy - S9 to Schonhauser Allee and U2 down to Spittelmart. Make sure you get out from the correct side of the station (check your map against the street exit markers on the station signs), stay on that side of the street (Leipzinger Strasse) and head straight down the street towards the Lidl. It's only a few minutes away. You'll pass a wonderful stone monument on your left so you'll know you are going the right way. Before you get to the Lidl there's a tall apartment building on the left, and open space with a small car park, and you will see the Adina sign in red on the 5 floor building building on the next street. Just make the left, walk past the apartment building, cross the street and you are there. Could not be easier. Check in was simple. The staff, as does most of the people we encountered in Berln, speak English. The lobby has two separate small lounge areas that are quite comfy and nicely decorated. Our room was simply fabulous. We stayed on the third floor, the smoking floor. The room had a full lounge area and then a separate bedroom (closing door and all!) The lounge area had a couch, desk, table for two to eat at, and then a kitchen which was better equipped than my own! It's an apartment hotel so it came complete with all dishes, glasses, mugs, pans for cooking, oven and hob, microwave and dishwasher! You could stay here for a very long time! The bedroom had a large comfy bed (a bit on the firm side but we like it that way) and the fully equipped bathroom was off the bedroom. The only thing that I can think of that the bathroom did not come with was a shower cap so bring your own. It did have washcloths, which you dont find in every hotel room in Europe. Oh yes, and a washer and dryer behind the door! The hotel has studios, 1 & 2 bedrooms and for a family I can not imagine a better place to stay. In fact we encountered a few families and anticipated that it would be noisy but it was one of the quietest places we've ever stayed! The room looked out over the inner courtyard, a great place to have that last glass of wine of the night before you trundle off upstairs exahausted from your day. They will also serve breakfast out there in the summer. We didn't have the breakfast but saw them setting up for the morning. On the corner of the hotel is the integrated restaurant ALTO. Not a huge menu but large enough. We had dinner there twice and was happy both times. The staff was friendly and efficient. My husband asked, offhandedly, the closing time of the leisure center and the waitress said she didnt know. We thanked her and thought nothing of it and had just planned to ask the front desk on the way out but she went off and found out for us. My only minor issue is that the drinks seemed to be a bit more pricey than at the restaurants and bars we'd been to during the stay but not outrageously so and to have a nice bar/restaurant, with three outside tables, in the hotel you are staying at is a plus so it balanced out. You can also take your drink out to the inner courtyard which we did most nights. I didn't venture down into the leisure center but the hubby was impressed. Lap pool, sauna, all the work out machines - he gave it the thumbs up. Oh and it closes at 10 (or was it 11 - sorry, don't recall!) As with most of the hotels we researched in Berlin, breakfast was not included and at 19 euros we thought it way too pricey for us. Two recommended alternatives - as you a full kitchen pop back to Leipzinger Strasse and head over to the Lidl for provisions. It actually has a few shops there in sort of mini mall and there's a bakery as well. If you want to be fully "on vacation" go across Leipzinger Strasse to the Irish Pub almost directly across the street. It's the closest place we found that does breakfast, and what a good breakfast it was!, for less than half the price of the one at the hotel. And if you are very lazy they serve it at least until about 1pm if not later. Also, the Irish waitress was just lovely and since she had been in Germany for 20 years we had a right old natter with her about how things used to be from her perspective. The price of our room, considering the location (could not be better), accomodation, services, etc was extremely good. We paid 95.20 euros for the first 3 nights and 87.50 for the last two nights. Now in another review I read the writer commented that they felt unsafe walking to the hotel at night. Personally, for me, I felt absolutely safe and we never had problem. It's a place where people live and they are out walking dogs, going for late dinners or drinks or just being about. There were no people just "hanging around", the buildings were not sad, depressing, dour as you might anticipate it being in the former GDR, and we walked back from our days out every night up to about 11pm and never, ever had a problem. The hotel is very well located for seeing the sights. You can either hop on the U-bahn, or more ideally, walk to a large number of sights. You find things even when you are aren't looking, like this amazing mural and memorial to the 17 June 1953 uprising which we just tripped across walking back from Potsdamer Platz along Leipzinger Strasse. I very much recommend the Adina Checkpoint Charlie and when we go back, which we must as 6 days was just not enough for this amazing city, I will go back to the Adina without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford to splash out a little bit, do it here!”
Reviews.Author: revel_in_this
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, massive rooms with everything you need, excellent location, free Internet in the lobby. Couldn't have really asked for more from this place. A little bit pricey but actually quite cheap for what you get! Would stay here again *****

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JdbE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a cold December weekend in 2010 with my brother. We had a very large room and the beds could be separated, which the staff did for us and they did not forget, which is always pleasant. The location is great, very central and close to public transportation. It is a good hub from where you can explore all parts if the city. I would definitely recommend it for a trip with friends or family. Very good value for money hotel. clean, friendly, great location, spacious rooms, nice, lively vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling jewel in old East Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: jimminycric
Reviews.Content: Wow, was the Adina a wonderful surprise! Our family was a group of three adults and had two apartments, Rooms 324 and 322. Lovely new, large apartments with living rooms, kitchenettes, air conditioning that worked well...and a washer and dryer in the bathroom!! I would say the apartments were done in Mid-Century Modern or maybe even Bauhaus style. Not an expert, so I could be wrong, but the apartments were tastefully furnished. Our apartment windows faced a lovely outdoor courtyard furnished with tables and chairs. The location was a very quiet and safe neighborhood in old East Berlin. A subway stop was nearby, as well as a small shopping strip that had a grocery, drug store, bakery, etc. Not a lot of shopping there but enough for your needs. And the subway will get you everywhere else...very centrally located for transportation. Berlin is more populous and spread out than you think from just looking at a map. The Adina seems to be somewhat far from the attractions, but not really since the subway is nearby. But being Berlin, you will walk your legs off, there's so much to see and do. Plan to spend an extra day here and take it a bit slower. We spent 3 days but should have planned at least 4. Also the Adina had a good wireless internet connection but only for 2 devices at a time [bad news if you have 2 iPhones, a Blackberry, an iPad and a laptop with you]. If you buy the internet subscription be aware that you can make a short subscription last a really long time if you log off. Not all of us knew that, so some of us had a subscription that lasted days and some of us paid and paid. [This is not always true at other hotels; some of them run the clock until it runs out.] We had requested non-smoking apartments but none were available when we checked in. Turns out there was no problem because there was really little smell in them. Also, while there is a washer and dryer some of the apartments, be aware that they don't operate entirely the same as American appliances. And the instructions are in German! All in all, this is a great place to stay while in Berlin. Check out the bears around town and especially in front of this sparkling jewel of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: TheBrotyTwo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Berlin. The Adina apartment Hotel was an excellent choice. Without exception the staff were friendly and helpful. We had a ground floor studio apartment, which was so quiet and peaceful, and were able to breakfast at our leisure in our room. The restaurant facilities were also excellent, and we found the hotel to be a good base for walking to see many of the excellent historical sites. We'd love to go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: baloopa
Reviews.Content: Spacious suite with a proper kitchen (hob, microwave, fridge, dishwasher, washer, dryer) - with Lidl across the road (or Kaiser supermarket on the way back from stadtmitte u-bahn if you want branded foods) you can make all your meals in your room if you wanted. Excellent location - Not the liveliest part of town, but very convenient for everywhere: we walked to Alexanderplatz one evening and the Brandenburg Gate another, and Gendarmenmarkt is an easy stroll. As stated, close to Spittelmarkt and Standmitte u-bahn stations. Pool was great - we had it to ourselves most of the time, and the gym looks quite well equipped if you like that kind of thing, ad was also deserted. The only downside is that the rental bikes were the clunkiest in Berlin. It's not that they didn't work, but they were rather shabby and embarrassing alongside everyone else's sleek, basketed rental bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: daytripper14
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay here. Excellent in every way. The location is great - an easy walk to most places. The hotel has a cycle hire - cycling is a good option. The suites are fine - very clean and well kept. The restaurant serves good food, and the breakfasts are lavish - good value even at 19 euros. Staff very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Perfect for families with small children!”
Reviews.Author: lampe1978
Reviews.Content: We rented two suites at this hotel - one for me, my husband, and one-year old daughter and one for my parents. The rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated. I was pleased to find a full kitchen with dishwasher and even a washer AND dryer in the bathroom! The rooms were very clean and I had no problems letting my daughter roam around on the carpets. My only complaints are that such a nice hotel cheaped out on the toilet paper (one-ply!) and that the pool and jacuzzi were on the cold side. Other than that, this was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed it with staff that were friendly and courteous. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Neil00
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Huge room with full cooking facilities. Very comfortable bed, large bathroom, two TVs and a balcony. All staff very helpful and friendly. Just a few minutes walk from the centre of the city. I would go back to Berlin (there's so much to see) and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: Whitebridge
Reviews.Content: Lovely and fresh and spacious apartments with washing machine and drier, very quiet. Breakfast great. Good location, able to walk everywhere. Owned by the Australian owned Medina Apartments which were a surprise. Very helpful staff in the restaurant, just wanting everything to be right. This was our first stop after being on a cruise for 19 nights. Great spa and indoor swimming pool area. We had arranged parking with the hotel prior as we were in a nine seater van. We parked directly across the road, 14 euro a day. Well done Adina Apartments, I have no hesitation in recommending your hotel/apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gel79
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in these fabulous apartments. There is not 1 thing that I could fault. Its is in a lovely area that is quiet close to everything. Our Room was fab & really comfortable. The staff were so friendly and gave us a free 4 course meal because It was our 1st wedding anniversary. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Berlin and we will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: seekingmoments
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room and hotel with all the amenities. Full kitchen with a washer/dryer too. Kaiser's supermarket is the best with lots of wonderful produce and pre-made foods that you can warm in the microwave (Lidl's does not have a good selection) Fantastic breakfast! Great location and very close to metro too. Would not hesitate to stay here if it is within your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Aleks86
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a weekend in March 2011. Hotel is in the center, but in a quiet neighbourhood. The room was on the groun floor, so I could go to the garden straight from the room through the balcony door. The room was big enough, clean, with kitchen appliances (though I didn't have to use it); service was good, too. Altogether, very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay....”
Reviews.Author: Shammyowens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March 2011. The hotel was very nice, the street it is situated in doesn't exactly look fantastic but remember it is in the old Eastern part of Berlin (Mitte) The hotel itself looks very nice from outside and this theme continues inside throughout. Our room had a kitchen area which was nice, LCD TV, Wireless Internet Access and the other normal things you would expect. Our room looked out onto the courtyard which was a nice view. The location of the hotel was very nice and it provided us with full value for money. The gym and swimming pool were good additions, using the sauna was lovely after a day walking around the city. They provided us with great customer service, we forgot our plug converter which was annoying as we desperately needed it for phones, iPad and my girlfriend straighteners :-). I asked reception where we could purchase one from and they actually let me use a spare one they use behind reception. This really help and saved us a few quid in the process. To get there from Berlin Schoenfield just get a train ticket to Zone ABC Berlin, get the train to Alexanderplatz and then change to the U2 line and travel a couple of stops to Stadtmitte. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from there. Public Transport is very very cheap and very reliable. When you purchase a train ticket you need to validate it before travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Theatregirl1983
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was lovely and really good value, the rooms were huge and beds were really comfortable. It was within really easy walking distance from Friedrichstrasse, and Unter den Linden, and we walked most places during out weekend. It was also really close to the U-Bahn. The only problem was that it was quite far away from any night life and mostly it was just expensive restaurants catering to the luxury hotels in the area. That didn't really bother us too much as we're not really huge going out people, but it would have been nice to have a little more choice. The same chain's hotel on Hackesher Markt might have been a better choice if that's what you're after.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized room - good location”
Reviews.Author: LesSpitz Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good room, excellent value for money - great breakfasts. Hotel location ideal for the historic part of Berlin - within easy walking distance of most of central Berlin sights - Brandenburg Gate, Unter Den Linden, Museum Island, Holocaus tMemorial etc. Found a good selection of restaurants on Gendamermarkt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Spiggiewiggie
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our visit and would probably stay at the Adina again. The flat was spacious and had everything we needed. The little kitchen was perfect for making breakfast and snacks and you could prepare a simple meal there too. The bathroom was luxurious and the bed was very comfortable. The staff on reception were very helpful too - recommending restaurants and giving advice. Only shame was that the restaurant attached to the hotel was so expensive, so we didn't use that at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families/groups”
Reviews.Author: ndmalia
Reviews.Content: The photos of the apartments at Adina are spot-on. They are huge--lots of space for families/groups. The living/kitchen area was nice and having two bedrooms + two full bathrooms made everything very comfortable. We got a better deal (nightly rate + included breakfast buffet) on expedia, so be sure to shop around. We were not super impressed with the front desk staff, however. It seemed like we knew more about Berlin than the staff did, which was unfortunate. For example, when asking about a tour, the front desk woman was very brusque and said "There are lots of tours, you have to be more specific." When we were, she simply googled the name, turned the screen around and said "there." We had already looked the website ourselves but were hoping for a little more assistance and concierge-knowledge. With another woman, when we asked about getting a tour, she simply said "NEIN" and went back to her business. The bright spot was a front desk staff member named Dirk, who was AWESOME. He overheard our attempts to engage the concierge and stepped in to help. He offered to make some phone calls and got us our tour immediately. He really went out of his way! We were very appreciative to him--he was very customer-friendly and helpful. Adina was a very comfortable place to stay, with plush linens and a good mattress (very good sleep), a delicious breakfast buffet, and a good location (close to 2 U-bahn stops and 10min walk to Checkpoint Charlie). We also felt lucky to have the top floor, corner suite! what a view!

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: bluebex123 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The Adina Hotel, located just around the corner from checkpoint charlie and countless other tourist attractions, is really a great deal. The restaurant and reception staff made our lacking German vocabulary a non-issue, with just about all of them speaking a more than competent level of english they saved our blushes on more than one occasion. For the price we paid (we booked around 1 month in advance of our stay) you could be forgiven for expecting hostel style conditions, needless to say the high quality of service and facilities at the Adina came as a huge surprise. would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie1977
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio and it was a lot bigger than I expected. Clean, modern, well equipped and great staff. It was freezing and coming to back for a sauna and swim was great. Past reviewers have mentioned a naked man, who sadly was not in the sauna when I was there. There is also a lovely fire to warm up next to with a wheat beer, which I throughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with first class service”
Reviews.Author: gekko21
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for five nights during the first week of February. The hotel is well situated for Berlin's museums and galleries and is only five minutes walk from the underground. We arrived early but were able to check in even though the advertised check in time is 2pm. The reception staff were all really helpful and had a high standard of English (compared to my mediocre German!). We stayed in a one bed apartment, which was a great size and very stylish. The hotel is in a boutique, modern style with lots of home comforts. There was a king size bed, flat screen TV in both the sitting room and bedroom, CD/MP3/Tuner plus a kitchenette with all the requisite equipment and utensils. You have to pay for internet access but I didn't think that was necessarily a bad thing. I work in digital media and spend my life on the internet so it was great to have an enforced break from it. We only connected on one evening in order to check out museums and galleries on the web. We used the pool/spa facilities on most evenings and found them to be very clean with plenty of robes and towels to hand. The sauna is a good size but wasn't busy anyway. Like the previous visitors, we also encountered the naked man but we are pretty free and easy about these things. I kept my bikini on but would have happily discarded it if there were others going down that route :-). As it was, we didn't encounter anyone else in the sauna during our stay so I wasn't sure what the accepted protocol was! We did read about a popular sauna in Berlin where it was compulsory to go naked so I don't think it's such a big deal in Germany. I actually think that's a good thing and personally wouldn't have felt threatened had I been alone in there (I'm female). There's even a section in the DDR museum that deals with the appeal of nude bathing in Berlin. The pool and spa pool were not busy but it was February after all. It might get a bit packed in the high season as the pool isn't that big. Also, there were very young children in there on one occasion so it was a little noisy and not relaxing. It would be great if it could be restricted to adults in the evening so it's more of a chill out space after a busy day of sightseeing. We are runners but decided to leave our trainers at home so didn't use the gym facilities. However, the gym looked very well equipped and wasn't busy at all. We ate twice in the restaurant, which was quiet due to the time of year. The service again was fabulous with friendly staff on both occasions. I had both pasta dishes, which were very tasty and my partner had the Aussie burger, which certainly was a feast! There were good Aussie wines to be had also due to the hotel group's Australian connections. The only criticism of the menu would be that there was only one vegetarian dish and it wasn't obvious from the menu that it was veggie. If you love meat, you'll be at home with the menu though. The desserts were very good too, which was true of all the desserts we had whilst in Berlin. We ate breakfast in our room most mornings, except for a rather fantastic breakfast in Gendarmenmarkt one day. We were able to purchase all we needed from the minimarket along Krausenstrasse or from the Lidl on the next street. Neither offer a particularly extensive range but are adequate for basics. It was great to have a leisurely start to each day before we set out around the city. I would highly recommend this hotel and thought it was great value for money. It was my second time in Berlin, the first time being in the early 90s so it has obviously changed quite a lot! It really is an amazing city and my partner who was there for the first time loved it. We'll definitely be returning soon and will probably stay at the new Adina Hackescher Markt hotel to experience a bit more of that district.

Reviews.Title: “Okay location, but great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pamanda
Reviews.Content: I went to Berlin with my boyfriend to scope out the city for a potential job offer that I had. I had never been to Germany before, much less Berlin, and decided to stay in the part of the city known as Mitte - which is pretty much the center of town. Upon first glance, this hotel is located in a somewhat dodgy looking area (we arrived on a dreary rain soaked and incredibly windy day in February) but after wandering around a bit we discovered it was a quick walk to the UBahn (Subway) - about 5 minutes to the U2 or U6 line, and that it is also right near one of the big shopping streets, Freidrichstrasse (only about 5 minutes til you hit the street.) So while it seemed at first not to have too much around, it was not so far away from some more lively places. The hotel itself was beautiful. For about $130 a night we stayed in a HUGE room with a king sized bed and plenty of space to walk. The bathroom has a nice heated towel rack and a big tub, (I took a bath, which was great!) There was plenty of room for us both, and the little kitchenette was nice for storing some snacks and beer. I was disappointed there was no free internet in the room, or WiFi in the lobby - but they did have a computer for guests use 24/7. (I still think free WiFi in the lobby would be better, but did use the lobby computer more than a few times to look up directions or addresses, etc.) We also used the pool/jacuzzi facilities. The pool is rather small, but functional for swimming laps, and also a really nice touch in the middle of a city to have an indoor pool! The jacuzzi, again, was relatively small (I was in there with 3-4 strangers and there weren't enough hot bubbles to make the fact you were bathing with random people less obvious...) but it was nice to have as well. Then we were able to use the dry sauna which hit about 90 C (194 F) so it is not for the faint of heart! Again, it was so relaxing to sit in there after a long day of walking around. And the gym equipment, which I did not use, looked brand new and in really good condition. We had only one incident while staying at the hotel, which was infuriating to me, but the hotel did make up for it as quickly as possible. We had the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door to which I heard knocking on the door at 9:30 on Sunday morning and then heard the handle turn and the door open. I had to run up to the door to slam it shut before putting on a towel and checking to see who it was, "Housekeeping". I yelled that we had the Do Not Disturb Sign on the door for a reason and he apologized and quickly left. I told the front desk what happened and they were apologetic and when we came home later that night they had left us a bowl of fruit and two drink vouchers offering their apologies for the incident. This is does not affect my thoughts on the hotel, but I do think they might want to consider adding an additional lock that only the guest inside the room is able to open, because I felt uneasy that the do not disturb was not being respected by all staff, even when we were out of the room. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and were happy to come home and relax after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, spacious, comfortable suites and friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Malachite1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Berlin for the first time, accompanied by our (adult) daughter. Accordingly, we had booked a 2-bedroom apartment at the Adina at Checkpoint Charlie for four nights through Hotels.com. On arrival we found the hotel had no record of our reservation and they did not have an empty 2-bedroom apartment. But no problem ... they happily gave us 2 x one bedroom apartments adjacent to each other, which proved to be even more comfortable for the three of us than the 2-bedder would have been. Nor were they fussed about the lack of (pre-paid) booking: "Don't worry, we'll sort it out with Hotels.com.". Which they did! I must congratulate the staff for being so obliging. The hotel is in a good location ... walking distance to many of the sights and with easy access to the U-bahn. And for Aussies like us ... the hotel is Australian owned ... there are photos of Sydney and aboriginal art on the walls and plenty of Aussie wine in the restaurant. If we ever go back to Berlin we will head straight back to the Adina.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels i've been in”
Reviews.Author: Alfish73
Reviews.Content: The Adina hotel at checkpoint charlie is all you need. a great hotel in a very good location. just couple of minuteד from the U station, and all the buses u need. the room is amazing. you got inside all you need for a very comfortable staying. the location is also close to the main streets, but its located in a quiet street in a good neighborhood. we will be happy to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: Socalesq
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Adina Checkpoint Charlie for 3 nights in a 2-bedroom apartment.
