The Adina is set up as a hotel (with lobby, restaurant and reception) but the rooms are like apartments with a kitchen, living room, washer/dryer, and in our case, 2 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms. This arrangement is great for families wanting the best of both worlds. On the plus side, the rooms are modern, comfortable and spacious. There is a small indoor pool in the basement (also an exercise room, sauna and lukewarm jacuzzi). The location is very good...there is a metro station about a 3-minute walk away and it is also a very short walk to the Brandenburg Gate and Unter der Linden. An adequate if not overly impressive breakfast buffet is offered for 15 Euros/person. The hotel staff was (eventually) accommodating, if not particularly warm. And now for the minuses...speaking of warmth, the first apartment we were given had no working central heating, which we only discovered after unpacking the first night. We were initially told by the hotel employee sent up to check on the heat that it should come on in awhile and to be patient. When this didn't occur, we called the front desk again and were told that a space heater could be brought up and maintenance would look into the problem in the morning but that there were no other rooms to move us into at the moment. Since there was already a space heater sitting in the hallway of the apartment, it seemed like management was probably aware of this problem already. The temps were in the teens and it was obvious to us that a space heater wasn't going to be adequate to heat 2 bedrooms. it took another phone call (in which we had to voice our displeasure with the situation more forcefully) to get our room switched to another (which was identical to the one we were leaving except the central heat worked). We were brought the new keys, but there was no offer to help move our bags to the new room or any apology for the inconvenience. We also learned that the wifi service, which cost 15 Euros/Day, only covered one connection per room, so a family like ours with 3 laptops between us (I know, excessive perhaps but we were traveling with a 20 and 17-year old) had to share online time. The other hotels we stayed in during this trip offered free wifi with no limitations. So the bottom line here is that I would recommend the Adina to a family or group of travelers looking for that hard-to-find combination apartment/hotel in a very good Berlin location. BUT, I also feel the Adina could provide better service and amentiies to its guests.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sydneysider3
Reviews.Content: Spacious and clean hotel, close to three supermarkets, main drag at Friedrichstrasse, 20min walk from Museum Island and close to bus/train. Staff were polite and helpful, offering an instant upgrade to a 1 bedroom apartment on arrival. Also very helpful whilst we were stuck there during the pre-Christmas snow lock-down enroute to London. The 1 bedroom apartments are large and comfortable with fridge and dishwasher, washer/dryer and all cooking utensils. The free internet access on the lobby computer could be improved. The 60min limit for each user made it a bit awkward for making bookings etc, especially when teenage Facebookers were online. A 20min limit per user would perhaps be more appropriate, so that Facebooking, travel and business email could all be achieved without too much waiting. Another thing that could be improved is the pool area which had coin-operated lockers (this was inconvenient) and had a very limited number of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: choccyluvver
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. It was in a great location, 5 minute walk to the train station and far enough away from a busy street, so it was quite at night. The staff were really friendly and the room was great. As you can imagine from the name it was an apartment, so you had a kitchen and seating area as well as a spaceous bedroom area and nice bathroom. Really clean as well and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: julia687
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights over Christmas and would recommend it for a festive stay. I had a studio room which was clean & comfortable. The kitchenette was great, it had a microwave, toaster, kettle, plates etc but my room for some reason had no forks, the fridge was stocked with a few beers (€3.50 per beer), wine was €8.50 for a half bottle of red or white and a selection of soft drinks but there was still plenty of room for your own items. The bed was very comfy, there was an iron and ironing board in the wardrobe, the sofa was nice for sitting watching tv and the tv had the usual CNN & BBC world english channels. You could rent movies for I think €7 each or for €10 you can watch as many as you want untill 12pm the following day. The bathroom was well equiped with a good shower, heated towel rail and unusually a hairdryer which was really powerful! I had room 501 which was nice and quiet. Breakfast was included in my room rate and there was a good selection of hot and cold food. It is €19 if it is not included for you and in my opinion I would cook something in your room instead. Location wise it is great, Spittlemarkt is the nearest Ubahn station and Stadtmitte station is not much further, if you are visiting the sights in Mitte walk instead of taking the Ubahn as everything is much closer than you realise. There are various restaurants all within a 10 minute walk of the hotel serving a varity of food types. The city was very snowy and very pretty when I was there, though it did mean that walking took a little longer. Lidl is moments away for stocking up, over Christmas it closed at 2pm on 24th and didn't open again until 27 December, however on the same street as the hotel was a small market which stocked the essentials and this was open over christmas. Berlin is a great place to spend Christmas and would recommend Adina what ever time of year you find yourself in Berlin, its a great city and I can't wait to return for my 3rd visit.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice if staying in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TeamBostik
Reviews.Content: A great stay in the smart, modern Adina Checkpoint Charlie. Our Studio room was excellent and the buffet breakfast very good. A really central location - we were in Berlin for the Christmas Markets and probably the best one (Gendarmenmarkt) was no more than a 10 minute walk. Similarly, 3 tube stations are no more than a 10 minute stroll. There is a Lidl supermarket nearby but the Kaiser supermarket along Leipziger Strasse had a better selection of items - and you pass it whilst walking back from U Stadmitte. One mistake I think we did make (nothing to do with the hotel) was buying the 5 day Berliner Card ; Berlin is not like London where you have to hop on/off the tube to get to places - it is relatively compact and we walked to most places. If I was going back I'd just walk to most places and pay for any particular journeys to, eg, the Olympic Stadium, Schloss Charlottenburg etc. And I'd definitely stay again at the Adina.........

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Checkpoint Charlie and the Berlin Wall...”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHorizonChaser
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great value for tourists. you feel like you are in a boutique hotel with a level of service that is personalized. The rooms are large and have all the facilities that you will need. located near Checkpoint Charlie and the Berlin Wall walk. the hotel is located off the main streets and has residential apartments around it so you really do feel that you are living in Berlin and not just visiting. other main tourist sites are a 5min taxi ride away, so this was never a problem.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Home @ Berlin-Mitte”
Reviews.Author: DerKronberger
Reviews.Content: Great Recent hotel in a quiet side street near the main attractions of Berlin Center. Big and comfortable Apartment style rooms with small kitchen. Nice fresh contemporary decor. Excellent swimming pool and nicely equipped gym with sauna. Covered parking lot, too. Grocery Stores, wine shop and bakery nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alibobsManchester Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in every way, It was very clean and the room was large and had everything in you needed. The breakfast was very good and the staff where very friendly and helpful. It was in a great place for sight seeing, eating out and shopping. I will definately stay there again when i go to Berlin which i will as its a great place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Highest recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: wdb39
Reviews.Content: Modern, tastefully decorated, and clean. Truly first-class. I was a leader in the group with Mark Hefti and agree wholeheartedly with all of the comments which he posted Aug. 5.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Europhile2
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio in this aparthotel and had our room upgraded at no extra cost to an apartment, with spacious living area and kitchen, separate bedroom and bathroom. It was excellent value for money and very comfortable. We made good use to of the pleasant hotel bar with half-price drinks available early every evening. The location was handy for all the main sites from Checkpoint Charlie to the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag, and the Spittelmarkt metro was only about 5 minutes walk away if we wanted to go further afield.

Reviews.Title: “3 star prices - 4 star rating - 5 star quality - higly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nzwccw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 510. We paid for a std room, but got upgraded at check-in. The room was very nice. It had a small kitchen and a laundary with a washing machine and a dryer. The double bed was in a seperate bed room with a balcony. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel has an inground swimming pool in the basement which we didn't get to use. The breakfast was very good with a good selection of food. In general, apart from the location (2 underground stations away from the city centre), it's perfect. If you are from Australia, you would notice they have a good selection of Australian wines and meat on the menu. They also have Aboriginal artwork on the walls. The only thing which we didn't like was wi-fi internet was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, recommend”
Reviews.Author: theskin
Reviews.Content: A 20 minute walk from museums and everything you want to see in Berlin on a weekend break. Very spacious, modern and comfortable rooms, with kitchen so you can make your own meals if you wish. Definite recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not far short of Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MGABZ
Reviews.Content: The Adina Checkpoint Charlie has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Everything from the Staff to the Room were excellent. On arrival we were upgraded from a Studio Apartment to a One Bedroom Apartment, and was checked-in by a very pleasant and cheerful member of staff. The hotel itself is located in the Mitte district of Berlin, and is located within walking distance from two U-Bahn Stations (Spittelmarkt in the West, and Stadtmitte in the East) which provide cheap and convienent travel accross Berlin. On arrival at Tegel Airport, we took the TXL Express Bus to Unter Den Linden and it was a short walk (along Friedrichstrasse) or a short taxi ride to the hotel. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and were very approachable. The One Bedroom Apartment was very spacious and provided more than enough space for two travellers. The room is well equipped with a Kitchen Area (complete with Tumble Dryer and Dishwasher) and separate bedroom area. We ate at the hotel resteraunt, Alto, which I must say provided an excellent meal at a very reasonable price (by European Standards). My only critism of the hotel, which is not entirly the hotels fault, is with the Leisure Facilities. The hotel provides an excellent unmanned leisure facility (containing a well-equipped Gym, Swimming Pool, Sauna & Jacuzzi), however is slightly on the small side. A group of no very well behaved younger children had taken over the pool meaning other hotel guests were unable to utelise the facility. On complaining to a member of staff at the hotel, nothing was done, and we had to end up leaving. I think the hotel should consider introducing a full-time member of staff to supervise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kikivancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adina hotel for 6 days in September. Its well located in Berlin, on a quiet street but close to subway stations so everywhere is close. It in the old east berlin, which i found the most interesting part of the city. The hotel amenities are very good, very clean swimming pool, sauna and the gym had everything you need. The room was very large, modern and clean, we had a one bedroom with kitchen. There was a grocery store less than half a block away and the prices were very reasonable. The washer dryer was great. The only thing I feel could use improvement was the service in the restaurant. It was very inconsistant and it depended who was on shift. Besides this I would highly recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved staying here”
Reviews.Author: WCS2
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and son for 5 nights. We were thrilled. The 1-bedroom apartment was very roomy as well as chic, with plenty of closet storage, a full kitchen (beautifully equipped), gorgeous bathroom, and even a washer-dryer (tucked away for quiet). The entire hotel was very clean, and also quiet. Modern, hip style - but yet friendly service - not snobby. The breakfast was excellent too. The pool stayed open late, which we loved. Location was pretty near the subway and also conveniently near grocery stores. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated and modern hotel BUT our room wasn't what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: adelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-September for our first trip to Berlin. Details as follows: Pros: - Convenient location, about 3 or 4 blocks to Checkpoint Charlie. Not THE best location, as that would probably be saved for the Kempinski near the Brandenburg Gate, but still within walking distance to the major sights. - Reasonably-priced (at around $175/night) - Modern decor with clean lines and a great color palette. Lobby and bar areas were also nicely decorated. Rooms were also very spacious, with lots of closet room and space for luggage. Cons: - We were disappointed with the specific room given to us as it was for a handicapped person. The layout was different and the bathroom had no enclosed shower. Granted, we were one day late in arriving as our flight from Warsaw got canceled, but I called the hotel the day that we were supposed to get to Berlin, so as to ensure that our room wasn't given away and that we were checked in. Over the phone, I was assured of this. However, when we checked in, it the staff couldn't seem to find any record of my conversation and they had to scramble around looking for a room. We probably ended up getting the worst room they had. - Breakfast was not included in the room charge -No wifi

Reviews.Title: “Could not find fault with the hotel - lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: Feedback186334
Reviews.Content: I would definately return to the Adina hotels. they were very plush, but not so it was found uncomfortable. I found the staff approachable for questions as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: wwtraveler11
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom which was HUGE! It was a very quiet room at the end of the hallway. The room was very nice and had a full kitchen (which we did not use) and a separate bedroom and bathroom. The staff was very friendly and held our luggage at the desk as we had a later flight out of Berlin. It’s about a 5 minute walk from two U-Bahn stations and close to Checkpoint Charlie. The restaurant downstairs was great for dinner. Also we did not know it at the time we booked, but there is a washer/dryer in the room that is free to use (there is a charge for detergent unless you bring some). We will be sure to check out other Adina Apartment Hotels when we travel and would recommend staying here while in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodation in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: ISSY49_10
Reviews.Content: Very central location. Spotlessly clean and very roomy. Staff very efficient and hellpful and the facilities were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Pam91710
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were very accomidating. We were able to walk or bike (rented from the hotel) to all the sites we were interested in (major tourist sites). We felt very safe walking to and from the hotel at night. I wish the wi-fi had been free but a computer was provided for guests in an alcove of the lobby and there was never a wait to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Good extended stay choice”
Reviews.Author: xeno111
Reviews.Content: As the name indicates, it's near one of Berlin's busiest tourist sites, but not too close for comfort. It's on a quiet block a good walk away from Checkpoint Charlie. U-bahn stations are also a few blocks away. Rooms are clean and roomy with room to prepare meals if you like. Some of the larger ones have the very convenient feature of a washer and dryer. Very comfortable bed. Blackout curtains are useful for those seeking a jetlag-fighting daytime nap or a long rest after a late Berlin night. Wi-fi prices are steep compared to a corner Internet kiosk, but not out of line with a business hotel. Service was usually fast and reliable, and when it wasn't, the staff offered a refund of charges. The front desk staff was friendly and effective, with exactly one exception. Restaurant, lobby and a small outdoor courtyard were all comfortable. Didn't make it to the pool, but the robed guests leaving it seemed happy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Rooms, Location is OK not more.”
Reviews.Author: ronari2
Reviews.Content: I slept in the hotel for 5 nights in September 2010. The rooms are big with a fully equipped kitchen (you can cook whatever you like), there is a supermarket nearby (2 min walk). There is a living room and a sleeping room both has a flat TV. The hotel is located 5-7 minutes’ walk from the nearest U-station (U2). Breakfast is OK. The Bad (tough small ones): In one of the nights they forgot to put new toilet paper !?. They charge 2.5EUR for using Tea and Coffee in the room, I would expect to receive it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic comfort and value in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ubertourist
Reviews.Content: The Adina is perfect for a long weekend in Berlin. The apartments are spacious, very well furnished and have all the comforts you need. Having the extra space is so liberating compared to a single hotel room! The staff were very helpful and the bar is great for cocktails. It's a short walk to checkpoint charlie and the central sights but once you master the bus and tube system (simple) Berlin is very easy to navigate. I was so impressed with this place that I wouldn't hesitate to use Adina again in other cities and have been looking at apartment hotels for other holidays as well. It's the way forward! Berlin is fantastic. If you are interested in history you will need more than a long weekend to do it justice. The Topography of Terror museum built on the site of the former SS headquarters is a particularly well presented. We also went for drinks at the Radisson Blu just to see the amazing 30m tall aquarium built in the atrium bar and I have to say that is well worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartments .”
Reviews.Author: cody666
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and would recommend these apartments without hesitation . From Airport to Hotel for euro2-10 in about 40 mins . Clean and comfortable and ideal for all the main sights . Turn left for Freidrichstrasse and Checkpoint Charlie Museum or Right for Museuminsel . Don't be put off by the high rise flats opposite as in 4 nights we heard no noise and virtually no people hanging around them . Excellent .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic,Modern, Clean hotel with great amenities!”
Reviews.Author: RupalLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and were on a city break for a few days in Berlin. When seeing the reviews on trip advisor we were sold.- The picures do not lie, this place is great. Well presented, the reception staff were very helpful and polite. We used the swimming facilities and gym every day- which were clean and well kept. The rooms were decorated beautifully giving you a relaxing feeling. The beds were so comfortable and both my husband and myself had the best sleep in ages!!! There is a Lidl near by which is always helpful about 10min walk away- so you can buy food and drink. To get in to the town centre it is a good 20min/half hour walk but time passes quickly as it's quite nice just to observe day to day berlin life and the architecture. I would definitely recommed doing a guided bike tour with FAT BACK BIKE TOURS - possibly one if the best decisions we made when going there. We had a fantastic day out, got to get some exercise in, saw all the major sites, had a few drinks in a Beer garden and met some nice people! The guides were all very knowledgable and knew about the history of Berlin and were able to explain all the sites and answer our questions! Weather was also fantastic which was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't think of a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: QuintessentialTips
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and found it an exceptional hotel. The hotel is quiet and close to bus/tram/train routes - about 2 to 3 blocks away from the bus routes and from the underground station. It is very close to Checkpoint Charlie (about 3 to 4 blocks away from the start of the outdoor museum panels on the Checkpoint - plan on spending an hour to read all of the information on the various panels). We had a queen sized suite - the cost not that much more that looked out into an outdoor courtyard. The room was large, the kitchen unit and fridge were more than adequate. The room was spotless and the air conditioning was welcome (as were the windows that opened). The breakfast is more than adequate - salmon, eggs, sausages, fresh fruit, cereals, variety of breads/rolls, olives, cheeses - no need for lunch if you eat a late breakfast. The restaurant is great - a bit surprising to see kangaroo on the menu (it is an Australian chain) but the food was excellent and we had an excellent waitress. The hotel has a long stainless steel pool on the bottom floor but with a glass panel looking up into the courtyard it is not claustrophobic. There is a fitness room, sauna, as well. The pool area was spotless. The inner courtyard is wonderful in the hot summer - we brought out bottle of wine and sat and read before dinner. They also deliver drinks and food outside. We were very pleased with the staff who were very knowledgeable about the area. One tip, if you are interested in a unique tour of Berlin head to the little square in Old Part of East Berlin, along the canal near the Spree Restaurant and look for Rudi and his golf cart. His English is excellent and having lived his life in Berlin has countless stories to accompany the sites - well worth the cost of 5 Euros per person - the golf cart goes where the buses can't and he can stop at each site to explain it.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, well designed rooms with a/c in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: retiredtraveler70
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom suite for three adults (my husband and myself and our college-aged son). More than adequately equipped kitchen, large living room, two bedrooms and two baths. The decor and equipment were all new and well designed. We specifically chose to pay extra for this hotel because we wanted a/c in August; the a/c kept up with the humid, warm weather we experienced. The U-Bahn is an easy walk, as is Gendarmnmarkt with good cafes for breakfast if you choose, as we did, not to do breakfast in the hotel. There are also two grocery markets close by if you choose to make breakfast in your suite. The Adina is not the cheapest hotel in Berlin, but you get what you pay for. Only quibble: wifi connection cost $14.50 per day, and there is only one computer is available available in the lobby, although when the queue got long, and the printer connection didn't work for our boarding passes, we were allowed to use a computer at the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent aparthotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: JJN34
Reviews.Content: All has been said before so we will not repeat it here. In summary: Excellent place to stay. Hope they do not raise the prices with all these great compliments. Some tips: In front of the hotel you will see a parking. Go across the parking and you are on the Leipzigerstrasse. Go to the left and find a Lidl supermarket, a large drugstore, a snack bar and a bakery (for the brötchen in the morning and the kuchen at tea). Bakery open at 6 in morning. Closed on Sunday. All within 5 minutes. How to arrive at hotel: From Tegel airport take the TXL bus and leave the bus at Unter den Linden, cross Friedrichstrasse. Across the street is the large Volkswagen showroom. Follow the Friedrichstrasse (20 minutes walk) until Leipzigerstrasse and cross it. Walk to the left (10 minutes) until you see the Lidl supermarket. Go to the right and find the hotel. Ofcourse you can sit in the bus until final destination at Alexanderplatz and take a taxi but in our case upon arrival the driver did not know the Krausenstrasse so we decided to walk with the luggage for our return to Tegel with TXL bus. In general: You can easily walk to the Gendarmenmarkt for a drink and diner. All within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel-LK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Adina hotel after our flight from the United States and were very pleased with the accomodations. Our trip happened to be during a heat wave, so the air conditioning was a very welcome plus. We stayed in a one bedroom unit and it was very clean and quiet. The small kitchen was very functional, and we used it for dinner twice (We had stumbled upon the gourmet floor at the Ka Da We department store and simply couldn't resist what was there -- you will be amazed at the selection and quality!). The restaurant was good and the breakfast buffet plentiful and tasty. Although they seem to run with a limited number of staff, every one of the employees was very friendly and accomodating to our needs. The location is great for site seeing as well. Definitely a great value for Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Adina Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toonis
Reviews.Content: 1. Service is friendly 2. We stayed in the studio room, good size, modern, clean and most importantly the beds were comfy and after a long day walking/cycling around the city it was nice to come back to the studio and have a good nights sleep. 3. Hotel is walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie, also close to the metro station (spittelmarkt). We used the metro to go to Alexander Platz, but u can also walk or rent a bicycle (a lot more fun) 4. All in all a great stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: bnsqaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Berlin, the Adina Apartments were well located so that most popular tourist sites could be reached on foot, exploring Barlin as you walked. The Hotel provided twin share accommodation with facilities for shopping for food nearby to provide you with the option for making own breakfat & snacks. Also has a very good value restaurant and bar within Hotel on ground floor. Friendly helpful staff to help guide you to get your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experience”
Reviews.Author: chalma
Reviews.Content: On avarage of 110 euro/night we got a new, nice decorated and full equipped apt. The room has bedroom separated by an open wall a living room and a small kitchen with all equippment. The forniture i snew and the quality of the apt is on top. The hotel has also a nice steel swimming pool (small but great to swim) and fit center. Located at 15 mins from center and 5 min from metro station. Reccomanded.

Reviews.Title: “Two-room suite was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: HonorCrown
Reviews.Content: The Adina had an incredible mix of location, comfort, service and price. The layout was fantastic, with a separate area for an "office" and generous space. The desk clerks were efficient and pleasant. The pool in the basement looked nice, and the gym was adequate (but not great) although too warm for serious exercise. Nearby there are inexpensive restaurants and grocery stores. We have been traveling in Europe for over a month now, and the Adina was the nicest of the places we have stayed in a comparable price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....But the Location....READ!”
Reviews.Author: JLG29907
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Checkpoint Charlie and here is our verdict: ROOMS: We stayed in their One Bedroom Apartment and was instantly thrilled by the size of the room that comes with a long study table and a fully functional kitchenette. There are two TVs in the room - one facing the bedroom and the other facing the dining area. Very high ceiling in the rooms and big windows. p/s: Internet is not free and it cost 3.50 euro for 3 hours. F&B: Breakfast was not included in our booking. The price of the breakfast buffet per person is 18 euro. p/s: We took a walk up towards Stadtmitte Subway and chance upon an excellent breakfast place called 'Kulturcafe Quchnia' @ Markgrafenstr. 35. They served a huge variety of hearty breakfast at a very reasonable price. LOCATION: The location of the hotel would not have been an issue if it wasn't 37 degrees celsius in Berlin at that time. It was just so hot to walk through a looooooong carpark driveway (about 7 mins from hotel entrance to Charlottenstr.) and another 3 mins from the junction to Stadtmitte Subway. p/s: For the ladies, even if Berlin is not a dangerous city per se, there are a few dark alleys around the hotel (which can be short-cuts) that I wouldn't recommend taking. The looooooong carpark driveway is very dimly-lit at night which can feel uneasy if you're walking alone...

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY WITH THE FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: gkaraca76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed very close to the centrum. Inside is very nice, modern designed, ultra clean and full equipped. You have everything that you may need in a flat. The nicest thing for the families with small kid is that there is wash and drying machine in the room. I could wash all the dirty clothes of my son every second day. The personal at reception were also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Adina Hotel saved our Berlin vacation!”
Reviews.Author: JoMarchElCajon
Reviews.Content: Berlin was over 100 degrees during our July stay and we needed AC. After dying in the unairconditioned Circus Hotel, we switched to the apartment-style Adina Hotel and booked 2 rooms at 77 euro a night, getting a World Cup special. Our teens loved having their own kitchen, washer, dryer and appreciated the pool and excellent breakfast included. Plenty of breakfast choices for our vegetarian teen too. It is quiet, very clean, attractively designed and the staff is multi-lingual and patient with badly spoken German. We loved this hotel! It is a 5 minute walk to subway and 5 to 10 minute walk to restaurants. Nice on site restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: iwannag0there
Reviews.Content: Berlin and the Adina happened in the middle of our 12 day trip and we loved this hotel! The hotel was very clean and well run, and the washer/dryer was a lifesaver! Traveling with 2 teenagers made the elbow room much appreciated. We enjoyed a "German Breakfast" by walking to the bakery and eating at the small table in our apartment, it was very nice to have privacy as a family. The restaurant on the ground floor is very nice- don't miss the kangaroo steaks- surprisingly good, but avoid the cheese platter dessert unless you are acustomed to extremely strong cheese-embarrassing for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and set up”
Reviews.Author: pragbov
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights in one of the one bedroomed apartments - with our dog. Quite a few other hotels would not take our well tarvelled and well behaved pooch. The aprtment was very well equipped (we wish we could have stayed longer to get full value!). Good kitchen area, well equipped, washing machine, dryer, iron, good sized lounge, bathroom and bedroom. Very modern and really nice to use as a base. Staff were helpful and parking easy. Great location - easy to walk to many of the sights and some good eating places and also close to metro. If you did'nt want to use the kitchen in the room, you can use the hotel's restauarnt/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and quiet and right in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: CKaSi
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel located in the heart of the city, with spacious, clean and quiet rooms with modern furnishings, then look no further. This hotel offers quality rooms and excellent value for money and is the perfect base to explore Berlin. Located in the Mitte district, the hotel is on a quiet street just off the major shopping strip, Friedrichstrasse, in central Berlin, and an easy and pleasant walk from major sights such as Checkpoint Charlie (5min) and Brandenburg Gate and Berliner Dom (10-15min either way). There is also an underground station located just around the corner from the hotel to take you to sights further away from the city centre. We went to Berlin in May and found our room to be comfortable, very clean and all the furnishings looked quite new. Because it was located on a quiet street off the main drag it is very quiet and you are able to get a decent night's sleep. The apartments seem to be self-contained to varying degrees - we stayed in a studio apartment so there was a small bench with a microwave, fridge and kettle. The bathroom is also quite spacious and modern. The staff are friendly and professional and all speak English. There is a mini supermarket located approx. 200m from the hotel on the same street, where you can stock up on basic provisions. We did not try the breakfast or the restaurant so I cannot comment on that. Other reviewers have mentioned a really nice Italian restaurant close by and we did go to one called Sangrantino (Behrenstrasse 47), which is within easy walking distance from the hotel and has lovely, authentic food (even all the staff are Italian). To get to the hotel, take the airport shuttle to Zoologischer Garten and then take the U-bahn (U2 line) to Stadmitte station. The hotel is just a five minute walk from the station. All the major sights are located in the city centre (eg: Checkpoint Charlie, Berliner Dom, Brandenburg Gate, Holocaust Denkmal, Reichstag) and can be reached by walking from the hotel. Otherwise, if you're too tired or to reach sights further away, the most efficient way to travel is by U-Bahn (underground). Get travel passes for one day or seven days, which offer unlimited travel on all forms of transport. Overall, we were very happy with our stay here and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Slow Duck
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Adina, and were very pleased with practically all aspects of this apartment hotel, i.e. the location, facilities, room, and staff. The only negative factor for us was that guests are allowed to smoke in the courtyard, which meant that since we had a first floor room overlooking the courtyard, we could not have the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: milky87
Reviews.Content: I really can't fault this hotel at all! The staff were brilliant and very friendly and the room was well equipt, spacious and clean. The hotel is situated in a quiet residential road and even when the windows are open there is virtually no outside noise at all. There are 3 supermarkets all within about 5 minutes walk (one of which was open on Sunday) and the hotel is only about 20 minutes walk from Unter Den Linden. Will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for quality + location.”
Reviews.Author: Limehouse_Lil
Reviews.Content: Only one complaint - all the communal areas including bar + reception tainted by smell of old cooking oil. This stopped me using the bar or restaurant as it's a smell that clings to clothes,hair etc + I am here on business. Other than that, agree with all the positive points covered by the other reviews. Fully-equipped apartments plus hotel facilities - best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mhr035
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend for my birthday. The location is absolutely great - close to everything (we like to walk). The staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English. The rooms are huge - it's basically an apartment. 2 Flatscreen tv's - one in the living area and 1 in the bedroom. One evening we were really tired and decided to stay in. We purchased the E18 movie option where you can watch any of the available movies from 12pm to 12pm (24 hours). They have great new releases available for you to watch and once purchased you can watch different movies in the living area and bedroom which I assume would be great for parents with kids or if you have different tastes in movies. Good sized bathroom and small kitchenette with everything. The linen was crispy white and beds also firm. I did see a stain on one of the scatter cushions. We didn't have breakfast or drinks at the hotel but did have a coke and beer from the mini-bar which I thought was very expensive. Go to one of the shops nearby and buy your drinks there in stead. We bought the city/travel pass for 3 days which included any travel on trains/ tubes/ buses in zone A,B and C. We took an overground/main line train from the airport which takes about 20-25 mins to the city centre. It is definitely worth your while to go to the Information desk at the Airport and buy your travel card and city tourist pass for the duration of your stay. They will give you the little red book with loads of information on all the sites and you will get discount on most attractions. They will also tell you how to get to the city centre in the shortest time. The Berlin tourist bus tour is definitely recommended - we got 5Euros discount pp with the little red book. We also did a boat trip which was enjoyable as it was very warm that weekend and we relaxed on the boat with a nice cold beer. All in all Berlin is a fantastic city and this hotel was a great find! We'll be going back to this hotel as there's so much more to see and do in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: karin96
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at this hotel for 5 days and we had a great time! the location was great, the room was fantastic and the stuff were very friendy. most recomended!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect minimalistic design hotel in the middle of Mitte”
Reviews.Author: from_oslo_with_love
Reviews.Content: Dont think I can find anything bad to say about this hotel. For a very good price we stayed in surprisingly large rooms, we had one double room and one triple room. The triple room was a small apartment, very large rooms and above 4 metres beneath the roof. The interior, design and art in the hotel main areas are very nice. The hotel is almost brand new and even got a great swimming pool and jacuzzi in the basement. The hot buffet breakfast was also very good. And with only 400 metres to friedrichsstrasse, this was a perfect stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Adina is as good as they said”
Reviews.Author: David92263
Reviews.Content: Having read earlier reviews of Adina Apartments I was a bit skeptical but it is all true. The reception staff is first class and friendly. I'm not planning to repeat everything that other reviewers have written. This hotel is a find. We searched for one downside. At a push it might be the location - not that it is a bad location but some ten minutes walk from the nearest U-Bahn often felt like a marathon after a day sight-seeing and we did a lot of taking taxis which at €5 a shot (seems to be the minimum in Berlin) added an un-budgeted extra. It would be wonderful to have a hotel shuttle to the nearest underground station but that's probably asking too much. Would we book again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “The Adina Apartment Hotel near Checkpoint Charlie in Berlin is clean, classy and extremely well located.”
Reviews.Author: lindagboulder
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Europe which ended with 3 nights at the Adina Apartment Hotel in Berlin. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, answering questions, providing maps and directions, making suggestions, etc. The food in the restaurant was levels above what we expected and the service was amazing. Our apartment was clean, quiet and extremely spacious -- even including a washer/dryer and small kitchen plus a large living room, not to mention a bedroom and bath. We walked to Checkpoint Charlie, the Brandenburg Gate, the Holocaust Museum, over to Under den Linden Boulevard and past the Gendarmenmarkt plus more. The hotel is in a great location and only a thirty-minute taxi ride to Tegen Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Combines the best of hotel/apartment facilities”
Reviews.Author: Albertine21
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here, the location is great, it's very clean and comfortable and in addition to the flexibility of apartment living, there is the bonus of an excellent reception, lounge and other hotel facilities. I stayed in a studio apartment and can confirm that it is bigger than most double bedrooms in European cities. The little kitchen area is very well equipped with a microwave, cafetiere, fridge, sink and crockery/cutlery for two people. There is a supermarket nearby, a larger one on Leipzigstrasse and the fabulous food hall in Galerie Lafayette in Friedrichstrasse to buy items for breakfast etc. Room cleaning was of a very high standard and the hotel was very quiet. I thought itwas excellent value for money and would be very suitable for a business trip if you didn't want to eat out all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mad_dublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in a large, comfortable, well appointed rom with a small kitchenette and bathroom on the ground floor. Weather was excellent and was able to open the windows and walk straight out into the building's courtyard where there are chairs and tables and even a bar service if you want it. The area is quiet, safe and in walking distance to shopping on Friedrickstrasse where there are lots of hotels, restaurants and bars of various kinds. There is also a Lidl jut around the corner if you prefer. The Ubahn is about 5 minutes walk away and is on the U2 line, perfect for getting to all the main sights across the city. Tried the stainless steel swimming pool and jacuzzi as well and all well kept and spotlessly clean. Asked the receptionist for a recommendation for a restaurant in walking distance and she said she could not recommend any even though there are michelin star restaurants such as Vau or the Regent hotel as well as lots of other great restaurants off Friedrichstrasse. Only area in which I could criticise the hotel. Taxi drivers didn't know where it was so remember to bring the address with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: casajy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great service and good location in mitte and close to ubahn.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: Linz51
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend the Adina at Checkpoint Charlie hotel highly enough - it has the wow! factor as soon as you enter the reception area and we couldn't have been happier with our room which was beautifully designed and furnished and very comfortable. We got a great rate through 1800 Hotels (including breakfast which was also excellent) and we were very pleased with the luxury we got for the price we paid. The staff were courteous and helpful at all times...........there's also a happy hour in the bar between 5.30 and 7 where you can treat yourself to a nice cocktail or an ice cold beer. Would also recommend a nice Italian restaurant just along the road from the hotel if you don't want to go too far - called Lungamare Trattoria - we had a very nice meal there with good service and atmosphere. We thought Berlin itself was a great city for a weekend away - interesting historical sites, museums and sightseeing plus great bars, restaurants and shopping too - there's something for everyone to enjoy whatever your interests. We had a great time and will definitely return to both Berlin and the Adina Apartments. If you've booked to stay there I'm sure you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Olijaz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location, a superb hub for a weekend of sightseeing. Try the Italian rest on the corner if your legs are tired from sightseeing all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Fantastic City. Book it now....”
Reviews.Author: AdoptedGeordie
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Adina Apartment Hotel Checkpoint Charlie. We arrived at Tegel Airport and took the TXL bus to Unter Den Linden/Friedrichstrasse (2 .10 Euros each) and the hopped in a taxi to the hotel (about 5 Euros). The Hotel itself is situated in the old East Berlin, a stones throw from Checkpoint Charlie, a 5 minute walk to the Gendarmenmarkt and a 15 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate. Although on first impressions the area seems quite run down, a quick walk around will soon allay that fear, the look being more about redevlopment that anything else. The Hotel itself is fantastic. On arrival we were given the key to our studio apartment. We had asked for a room on a high quiet floor and had been given a room on the ground floor overlooking the private Courtyard. We had asked for a high quiet room as we were concerned that the Hotel may get noisy in the evenings so we asked to be moved. The Hotel were glad to accomodate us and moved us to the top floor and upgraded us to a one bedroom apartment. The room itself was superb and we were glad of the upgrade (although the studio would have been adequate I would strongly recommend the one or two bedroom apartments). A small kitchen and lounge area with all the facilities you would need for a stay away, including dishasher and washing machine/tumble dryer with all cutlery etc, a large bathroom and bedroom with a safe for valuables. We needn't have worried about noise from the Hotel as despite it being full of guests we didn't hear a noise during all our stay. The leisure facilities we had to ourselves every time we went. There is a nice pool (about 10/15 Metres and made of stainless steel but perfect for lengths), Jacuzzi and Sauna with a reasonably well equipped gym. The staff were superb and the hotel bar and food perfectly reaosnable, although a steak can be quite priced at 24 Euros. The Hotel itself is absolutely spotless, as is Berlin as a whole. In short this is an absolutely superb hotel and a fantastically located base to explore Berlin from. In our opinion the old East Side is by far the best side. We bought a Step by Step guide to Berlin, which gives 14 walks around Berlin and it turned out to be a very good purchase, shpowing us parts of Berlin we would not otherwise have seen. In short if you are thinking about going to Berlin then do not hesitate to do so. It is a beautiful, historic place. If you are looking for a quality hotel to stay in Berlin then look no further than the Adina and boook it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zammy59
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 3 nights and the whole experience was excellent. The one roomed apartments were clean, modern and equipped with everything you would need. The breakfast was very good with a wide choice and the staff were attentive. Happy hour in the bar was a bonus! We eat one evening meal and it was very good and better than some of the other meals we had. Berlin was as good as I had been led to expect and the location of this Australian hotel near checkpoint charlie was convenient. We had an excellent rate due to my friend finding a deal but I would have paid more for the stay. On a less positive note the single beds duvets were a little small and the bar shut at midnight which was unusual we thought. But all in all I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay With Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: icehoose
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the positive reviews on here and here's a brief itinery of our trip. We flew with Ryan Air as their flights had good arrival and departure times for us from Edinburgh Airport and a reasonable price as well. We left on schedule and everything was good apart from the annoying tannoys every 5 minutes with some sort of sales pitch from the stewardess/ steward trying to sell everything from scratch cards to a device that smokers could use as a substitute for tobacco. I am a smoker myself but I can survive a couple of hrs without the need to spark up. We arrived at Adina Apartments @ 11.00am and from the outside the hotel looked very nice. Upon arriving at the front desk we were greeted by a smiling receptionist welcoming us to their hotel. Check-in was swift and our room was ready, so we headed straight up. Accomodation: It was a nice suprise to see that we were upgraged to a 1 Bedroom as I booked a Studio Apartment. The apartment was very clean, also nice and warm on a cold Feb day. Like previous posts describe, all utensils are there including restocking of dishwasher tablets and washing up liquid. Not to sure if they supply washing powder as we didn't require it. There is also wall mounted flat screens in the livingroom and bedroom. The only downside to that was there is only 1 Brittish channel "BBC World News". But for all the time we were in the apartment that was not a problem. Restaurant: We decided to eat here as this was the first night and I'm glad we did. Our meal was well presented and tasted fantastic. We sat down at our table and we were greeted by a very friendly & enthusiatic waitress called Yvonne. For starters/ Tapas I ordered Bruchetta with Parma Ham & Salad and my wife had Currywerst, which is sliced German pork Sausage drizzled with a sweet,slightly spiced curry sauce and thin fries. As we placed our starters we were given a plate of french bread and bowl of olive oil infused with chilli (MMMmmm). Next our main meal arrived which was Kangaroo Steak and Avocado and sliced Chillis. I have never tried Kangaroo before and found it to be fairly tender with a slight taste of Lamb, but very nice it was. My wife opted for Buffalo Steak with marinated Baby Onions & Sauted Potatos, Red Wine Jus. The steak was cooked to perfection. We never tried any sweets as we were too full. In the last post the author described the service slow. There were a few people eating at the same time as ourselves and everybody was catered for. We ate at the hotels restaurant a couple of times and found it to be a good experience. The prices were slightly higher than highstreet restaurants but remember it's a apartments come hotel facilties. Amenities: On our 2nd day we decided to go down to the pool area @ 4.00pm. At this time it was really quiet and had the whole place to ourselves. The gym is huge and has all equipment that a serious fitnress fanatic would require. The pool is slightly cold but when you get swimming you soon warm up. We also used the spa bath... wow, the jets are so powerfull that it gives you a really good massage. You can also request bathrobes from reception to use in the pool area. As I mentioned before we were greeted by Yvonne who runs the restaurant. We cannot fault her in anything she does. We mentioned to her that we would like to do some shopping but found Designer labels more expensive than UK. Off she went and came back with shopping centres on the outskirts of Berlin and directions on how to get there with all the train & bus numbers. May I say this was in between serving at the bar and being aware of customers needs. 5 stars to you. Overall we really liked this hotel and will definitely be back but next time with our children and we also met some very nice people staying there. On our last we met Bridgett Nielson (Sly Stalones ex wife) who checked in to the Ardina. Very Nice Lady.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Service”
Reviews.Author: JenVAyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights after being unable to book into the Circus and I must admit I am really glad I booked here (not to say the Circus isn't good). It is only a two minute walk,if that, from Spittlemarkte station. I had booked a studio apartment and we were upgraded to a one bedroom apartment which was lovely, spacious and even had a dishwasher!! All rooms seem to have a balcony which I'd expect is excellent in summer. I would definetly recommend it for families as there is everything a family may need (washing machine, cooker etc). The pool was far too cold for me to use but it was good to have. The staff were friendly, however we found the service in the bar / restaurant very slow. It isn't that far from Checkpoint Charlie etc and the underground system is so easy to use. There is an Irish bar nearby, found this extremely handy when it got to minus 6. I would recommend BrewersBerlin Tours, only 12 euros for a 6 hours walking tour and extremely interesting. He recommended the German Historical Museum and this too was excellent at only 6 euros, spent a very long time in here and failed to visit all the exhibitions.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Mindmyonions
Reviews.Content: We found the Adina a perfect base for exploring the museums and other main sights in the city. We arrived at about 10 pm and ate in the restaurant on the first night. Eating out was not a problem though and we enjoyed exploring the local restaurants of which there are plenty. There's even a Lidl supermarket a very short walk away where we bought our breakfast stuff from, as we had a 1 bedroom apartment. I can't fault the friendliness of the reception staff. The apartment was spotless and well equipped. The swimming pool, gym and sauna were also very good. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Love it,love it,love it!”
Reviews.Author: marie943
Reviews.Content: As already said,great value,and super self catering facilities.we had a studio (this doesn't have washing machine or dishwasher btw).One of the nicest hotel experiences

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and central”
Reviews.Author: Rob2037
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adina Apartment Hotel for a week in early January 2010. There were three of us staying in a two bedroom serviced apartment. There is plenty of space and a well equipped kitchen (full oven, 4 ring cooktop, toaster, kettle, microwave, dishwasher and fridge). All cutlery, crockery and cookware needed to prepare meals for four were provided. The fridge doubled as a mini-bar, but with plenty of room for provisions. The nearby supermarkets (Lidl, one block away and Kaiser three blocks away) have a good range of food with a better range of wine at the Kaiser. One bedroom had a queen bed (the en-suite room) and there was a king bed in the other bedroom. Each bedroom has an LCD television and the main bathroom has a washing machine and tumble dryer. The sitting room had a dining table for four, a sofa, an armchair, desk and chair. The nearest U-Bahn stations are a couple of blocks away, with Friedrichstrasse shopping even closer. The staff were all friendly but not intrusive. We did not eat at the Adina as we sampled a number of Berlin eateries (particularly around Alexanderplatz), but the restaurant had a steady number of diners for both breakfast and dinner. Internet access was good, but rather expensive at €14.50 per day (wired and wireless are the same price and the Adina recommends the wireless as the wired billing is outside of their control).

Reviews.Title: “perfect base camp for daily excursions”
Reviews.Author: chucas
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very helpful, and everyone we talked to spoke English. Wi-fi is avaliable by access code cards from the front desk 3 hours of internet access for 3euro50. The buffet breakfast at the hotel has hard boiled eggs, rolls, drinking yogurts, fruits, cheeses, small sausages, juice/coffee/tea and eggs cooked to order. a little pricey- charged to your room bill- but undeniably convenient. About the room: The first thing you have to do when you enter the room is put your keycard in a slot to turn on the electricity. The room is modern-looking with grey walls, red curtains, high ceilings, and a view that overlooks the courtyard (see pic). TVs in both the bedroom and living room. When pulled close, the bedroom blinds really block out the light for a noonday nap. There is a safe deposit box in bedroom closet- swipe your keycard and enter a code. Best feature, by far is the Kitchenette: oven, stovetop, refrigerator, microwave. Hot water/coffee maker, and dishwasher. The kitchenette sink is shallow and circular. the kitchen cupboards are amply stocked with dishes, pots/pans/spatulas, and a salt shaker. Coca-cola and beer bottles in the tempting mini bar for 3euro each. Second best feature: the clothes Washer and Dryer! if you can figure out what the settings are by the symbols and german abbreviations. a small basket above the washer/dryer holds detergent tablets. The towel rack doubles as a heated drying rack, and an iron and iron board are also in the laundry closet. Shower has good pressure, very hot water, and a large tub. soap/shampoo/conditioner/lotion and toothpaste provided, in case TSA is being strict. About the surroundings: Walk across the street to Lidl- reminded me of Grocery Outlet here in the states. Across the street (via pedestrian tunnel) and down one block is another, more organized, grocery store called Kaisers (see pic) Kaisers has a bakery, and one [store] brand of each item. This is where I got my Listerine. And Kinderschocolades. Another block down is the medical clinic and pharmacy. I hope you won't have to go there but it's nice to know it's so close. We tried the chinese restraunt next door to Lidl's and thought it tasted... like Chinese! There were a few germanized potato-chinese dishes, but otherwise, as you'd expect. tasty tiramasu ice cream. interesting mechanical self cleaning toilet in the ladies room. As the hotel website promises, we walked to Checkpoint Charlie, and the souvenir shops, Cafe Einstein, Starbucks, and the Gendarmanmarkt. Since we were visiting in December, the square was filled with tents vending Christmas gifts and treats. It was a quick walk to the U-bahn station (see pic) and the train system in Berlin is very easy to figure out, and will take you everywhere you want to go for a lot less than a taxi. We were more than pleased with Hotel Adina, and if we return to Berlin we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “1 Of The Best In Europe”
Reviews.Author: Frankieswea
Reviews.Content: Staying this hotel for just 1 night,feel so down when check out.If there is a chance retrun ...never have second tough to come back again and again.Room is big and 2 flat screen tv and with mini hi-fi in room...also washing machine and dryer...is really apartmenthotel.Lobby was great,spending 1 week for vacation or business trip is never be too much in this hotel.Breakfast choice so good too,as i mention never regret to stay as this hotel.....Great Job to the GM.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pairofshorts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English, we were upgraded to a one bedroom apartment after booking a studio. Very comfortable bed with very nice linen and comfortable pillows. The location was perfect for us. We walked everywhere. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Spacious well equipped room, hotel close to many attractions, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ripley0
Reviews.Content: I went on mini-moon with my new wife Audrey and based the hotel choice on reviews on Trip Advisor. I wasn't put off by the negative comments regarding the hotel's location and thank goodness for that. Yes, it is in the old east sector of the city, and some of the neighbouring streets are a little drab (walls covered in graffiti etc), but at no point did Auds or I feel threatened or unsafe. And, within a five minutes stroll you were on Friedrichstrasse which is one of the main shopping streets in Berlin. When we arrived at about 6.30pm, we were checked in quickly and efficiently. The room was very spacious with a fully equipped kitchenette, separate (and large) living area with plasma screen and a separate bedroom also with it's own plasma. There was in-room internet which was chargeable and I think it was a bit pricey. We went down to the bar for a drink to find it was happy hour (half price drinks). These have been outlawed in Scotland so it was a definite bonus! Martin the barman was very friendly and gave us some tips about what to do and where to go. The bar area is pretty cool although because the hotel was empty after the Berlin Wall celebrations the previous week there wasn't much atmosphere. Breakfast is served in the bar/restaurant and there's so much choice it was unbelievable. Try to get a deal that includes breakfast because if you don't it'll cost you 16 euros each which could put a serious dent in your budget. I booked through 1800.com and got a stonking deal. The waitress was as helpful and friendly as Martin and got out a map to show us how to get from the hotel to various sites like the Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag etc. Both were a twenty minute walk away, so not far. Gallery Lafayette also has a store on F-strasse so you can be there in about 10 minutes. There are some restaurants around, and if you like sausages and food based around pig you'll be happy as a pig in [--]. There is a great (expensive) Italian eaterie on F-strasse called Bocca Di Bacco which is always busy (I'm told by a friend who went there) and that was a really good dining experience. There is also a spa in the hotel with a narrow pool, gym, sauna and jacuzzi. The only minus about it is that the tiles around the pool are so slippery that it's amazing neither Auds or I ended up on our backsides. Please watch out for this. All in all I'd thoroughly recommend using the Adina Apartment Hotel and would definitely go back there in future.

Reviews.Title: “faultless hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AmitP2
Reviews.Content: as with previous hotel reviews, great space in the room, clean and comfortable, lovely pool/sauna, convenient location....we found the staff very approachable and helpful. spoke great english and were friendly. would def go again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and service, main attractions only a walk away”
Reviews.Author: Trainrideaway
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I lwft booking a hotel a bit late after having some flights to Berlin arranged for some time. The Adina was the only place in our price range left. We were very pleased with the hotel. The welcome was very good- the English spoken by the reception staff was excellent- and the room very comfortable, clean and modern. the room had a small kitchenette which we didn't need, but would be good for families or longer stays. The sauna/jacuzzi and gym were brand new and excellent. The only minor grumble was that the pool was a bit cold. However it was a good size for swimming lengths. the changing facilities were very clean and there were plenty of towels etc. We didn't use the bar and restaurant and the breakfast looked a bit pricey but the hotel is so well located it was easy to walk elsewhere to eat. We like to walk everywhere on holiday but the underground was closeby if you wanted to go further. The hotel is close to Unter Den Linden and Checkpoint Charlie. We also walked to the eastside gallery, Brandenburg Gate and Television tower from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, complete, not expensive: could move into it;”
Reviews.Author: MasterBoneco
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 12 nights, with my sister, while on a longer trip throught Europe. Wash and drying machines are a must in these journeys and were excelent. Breakfest is OK, room is very spacious, wifi connection at very reasonable price. Kitchen also perfect to store some snacks and even do some cooking. Public is cool - not so cheap after all, but this hotel deserves the #1. When I made my reservations, it was #2 at tripadvisor, and this tip was excelent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: SteveyG
Reviews.Content: If staying in Berlin this is a good base. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the restaurant / bar serves good, if slightly unusual, fare (Described as German Tapas, but the theme is Australian (Kangaroo meat, Aussie Burger etc.) Within walking distance of many attractions and near the Metro. We visited for my 50th Birthday and the Hotel suggested and arranged a Restaurant for my birthday meal, unfortunately when we arrived at the restaurant all knowledge of the booking was denied (we know it had been made by the hotel, we heard them confirm it on the phone... for another short review of the restaurant later. The room(s) has everything you need. Kitchenette, Laundry area (washer/dryer Iron & board), Bathroom, sitting area with TV and very comfortable bedroom and TV.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel, okay neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: WPW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the main floor. Very nice large room with a small kitchen. We used the pool everyday and really enjoyed that after a hard day of seeing Berlin. Really a nice extra. We did find the location a bit out of the way and there is not alot in the immediate area. The bar/restaurant was good not great. My complaint would be the people smoking in the courtyard outside our room so the smoke drifted into the room. Thus we kept the windows closed even though it was beautiful out and could not use the nice sitting area we had outside. We told the woman at the front desk but she was indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “The untouched splendor”
Reviews.Author: AdamH3
Reviews.Content: Airport Tegel; suddenly finding oneself in the city which is the epicenter of all that is flush with progressive modernity, yet remains encapsulated in it's piquant history: Berlin. The Adina Apartment Hotel sists on the former Easter Side(which frankly, now looks better and more modern than the old western one), right behind Checkpoint Charlie, and is nessled close to the beautifull new Gallerie Lafayette, and only about 10 minutes walk to Unter den Linden. The Franchuzische Strasse metro is close by, and the area is home to many great German, as well as Italian and Turkish restaurants. Eventhough the Adina finds itself within these convenient surroundings, it is immediately surrounded by remnants of the past, including an old school that in non-funcionable in front of it, as well as renovated apartment blacks to it's left. The school especially, has a very portentuous feel, and for people who were born behind the iron curtain like me, it brings back certain memories. The Adina has a beautiful courtyard that is floridly decorated with aesthetically pleasing armchairs in different fluid designs and pastel colors. The courtyard is also beautifully specless and pristine, and the windowns of the other rooms looking inside necessitate a wonderous contrast via their white-rimmed pains. The buildings interior courtyard shows it's true beauty, revealing the burnished multicolored brick patters on the facade, with a Victorian-like bathhouse feel to it. Interesting, however is how the building manages to maintain a ceaslessly modern exterior. The apartment rooms are all very high standard in terms of maintenance, as well as technology. The chic clean-lined furniture mixed with the pastel-colored carpeting, and the silver kitchen applicances; add a very urbane sophistication. The bathrooms are very well equipped and do not leave out any detail for the discerning hotel connosseur. The shower has many settings and always provides the right amount of water an temperature for any guest. Even-though this is a detail many overlook, one does not truly appreciate this convenience until one experiences it. The only fault is that many rooms have a view of looking into the courtyard, which does not provide one with a good view, or any view at all, even-though if one can appreciate finely burnished facade tapestry and beautifully clean atriums with bonsai trees and colorful furniture, like I do, this is the hotel for you. If you find yourself with a room that does overlook the street, this is not much of a view either, as there is a run-down GDR-era school in front of you, and apartment buildings to the side. There is also a pipe of somekind suspended in the air, like a gas pipe, or something. However, these are not criticisms, they simply give the traveller a real view into Berlin, one that will truly give you an idea of what it is, for what it is, the real thing, an untouched splendor. Also, even-though the restaurant downstairs only has a finite menu selection, it is decent, and the decor leaves nothing to chance. The pool downstairs, although small can also proved refreshing. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Breifne32
Reviews.Content: Booked based on reviews - was not disappointed. Good location two blocks from Checkpoint Charlie and a four minute walk to the underground. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff and has a great small hotel feel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: David at 4a
Reviews.Content: I tried to book a repeat visit to an inexpensive very German pension hotel just off the Kurfurstendamm but it was full. I think that western area has more character. The Adena is a few blocks below the Unter den Linden easily accessed from the Spittelmarkt or Stadtmitte U Bahn stations. There are plenty of restaurant's and indeed one of the best in Berlin (Lutter & Wegner) is only a ten minute walk. The break did not go to plan. "Probably" a ham sandwich at EMA caused vomit fever and for once the washing machine and tumble dryer in the appartment were really useful. The staff at the Adena are very good indeed and were very supportive. The breakfasts are good but otherwise we did not eat at the restaurant - partly because I was not eating for half the stay and also because there is a good local choice. This is a quality place to stay and I hovered over "value" because you can have a good stay in Berlin for less money - but never the less I do not think it overpriced for what you get, particularly if you need to stay in for a bit!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: JenStirling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from our first trip to Berlin and we had a fantastic time. We arrived into Schonefeld airport which is a fairly nice airport and easy to find your way to the train station. Before you leave the main terminal building go to the tourist information desk on your right and buy a welcome pass, which basically covers all your travel for the time you’re there, ours cost €34.50 each for 5 days. The good thing about getting it from the tourist information office is they give you a little red guide book which tells you all the museums you get discounts with when you show your welcome ticket…. Well worth doing! You save at least 25% on all entry prices to museums. We took the S9 train to Fredrichstrasse and then the U bahn to Stadmitte. This will take you approximately an hour/1.5 hours, remember to validate your train ticket before travelling, little red box on platforms! Depending which exit you come out from the Stadmitte station you’ll be directly at the street you need to go along (Kraussenstrasse). Look out for a fitness first gym banner on a building and Enterprise banner and take a left there. The hotel is approx 5 minutes walk from there and on your right hand side (There is another tube station called Spittelmarkt near the hotel, but in my opinion it wasn’t as nice). The Adina hotel is fabulous and in my opinion in a fantastic location for all the must see tourist attractions! We arrived early and our studio room wasn’t ready which wasn’t a problem, but they then upgraded us to a 1 bed apartment which was ready. The apartment was brilliant and it was really nice having lots of space to chill out after a long day sightseeing! As people have said previously, it is literally 2 minutes from a Lidl store and another supermarket (Rossmans) which we used to stock up on snacks, drinks etc. Go out the hotel entrance through the car park at the block of flats and it is on your left on Leipziger Strasse, can’t miss it. We had breakfast included in our rate, which was good, nice selection of cereals, fruit, yoghurts, breads, meats, cooked breakfast etc. Enough choice for everyone and meant that we didn’t eat much the rest of the day! Also worth noting the hotel bar has a happy hour between 5.30-7 which is good for a quick drink on the way back to the room, the Reisling is pleasant as to is the Pilsner on draft. Didn’t eat in the hotel restaurant at night so can’t comment. The pool, jacuzzi and sauna was a brilliant addition and very nice after a long day sightseeing. A few of the previous reviews have said that the surrounding neighbourhood didn’t feel particularly safe at night and was the prettiest, well to be honest it was one street back from a main road therefore there was no traffic noise, and we felt nothing but safe walking back late at night, and the surrounding buildings are just stereotypical of buildings of that era. Location – literally 5 minutes walk to Checkpoint Charlie and Topography of Terror, turn left out of hotel and take a left again when you get to Fredrichstrasse. You can also walk to the TV tower, Gendermanmarkt (which is very pretty), Jewish museum, Potstamer Platz, Holocaust museum, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag (go early to avoid queues!) and Museum Island. It is quite a compact city in so many ways and very nice to walk around, if you didn’t feel like walking there are tube stops near all the main attractions. A museum that doesn’t seem to feature in many of the guide books (it’s in the red Welcome book) is the Anne Frank museum which is located on Rosenthaler Strasse, to me this was my favourite museum and the 30minute video they play is very interesting, it’s quite hard to find as it’s up an alley, but worth the look! The holocaust museum was also worth a visit. We took the S9 train out to the Olympic stadium which was worth a visit if you have time, just check that there is no football on! We also took the tube up to KaDeWe which is a fab but expensivedepartment store, especially the food court on the top floor! Just up from the department store there is the Kaiser memorial church which remains after the war, quite an impressive building to see. Eating – there is a nice Italian restaurant called Lungomare located less than 5 minutes from the hotel, take a left out the entrance and walk along until Charlotten Strasse, it’s on the corner. Maximillians is good, it is a traditional Bavarian restaurant, worth going to if you want to try the local delicacies! Its just of Fredrichstrasse, take a left from the hotel, when you get to Fredrichstrasse take a right, you’ll see a Mini garage on your left, it’s opposite. Another Bavarian restaurant that is very traditional is Lowenbrau which again is 5 minutes from the hotel. Go out past Lidl and take a left, you’ll see it on the opposite side of the road, at a set of traffic lights, it’s got a large blue sign. If like us your German isn’t up to much they do have an English menu, you just have to ask for it, I get the impression it’s not a very touristy place, which is kind of why we liked it! Amici’s restaurant in Gendermanmarkt is a very nice reasonably priced Italian, located in a very pretty building, it’s opposite the opera building. We went for dinner one night and a drink during the day another day, it always seemed busy which I take as a good sign! Seemed quite reasonable to me considering its nice location, 2 pizzas and 2 drinks €26. As you will probably tell we had a fantastic time in Berlin and would definitely use this chain of hotel again if we go back to Berlin or other cities where they have this chain! We booked the hotel through Travelrepublic and seemed to get a really good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, not #1”
Reviews.Author: roypeled
Reviews.Content: Followed their #1 rating here and reserved a room for 3 nights at this hotel. It is indeed a good choice, but Im surprised by its ranking. Froom good to bad - the cleanest it gets, beautiful pool, rooms are beautifully designed and well equipped, though our studio room cannot be considered spacious. Location is so-so, not far from the unter den-linden and Checkpoint Charlie and Potsdamer Plat, but not very close to any underground station (7-8 min walk), service - all staff was very friendly but while some were also helpful other were incompetent. worst was serious extra charge for internet use, which when complained about was met with mocking explanations and waiving charge "as a favor" and a complaint mail to the hotel was never replied to. overall good choice but could expect more from a 4star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For a great stay in Berlin - stay at the Adina”
Reviews.Author: VimarUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was something of a surprise to us. The location was not very glamorous at first sight but was , in fact, very convenient and perfectly safe. The hotel is exceptionally comfortable with extremely tasteful and stylish furnishings. The rooms have everything you need - and more. Very spacious with quality fittings and good beds. The staff were friendly, helful and polite at all times. The breakfast was first rate - even freshly cooked omelettes to order . The pool and leisure facilities are excellent but I do have one reservation. The tiles near the spa pool are treacherous; two of our party slipped here despite being very careful. So.....watch your step - literally! Apart from the slippy tiles this was the best hotel I have stayed in for some time and is of 4/5 star quality.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB HOTEL --- BEWARE OF RESTAURANT FOR EVENING MEAL”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor51
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Adina Hotel to anyone Planning a trip to Berlin. Great location. Rooms are amazing: big, clean, pretty. Modern appliances - our room had a washer and a drier, a mini-fridge, stove, microwave. Staff were incredibly nice and helpful. Indoor pool, gym and Jacuzzi. Everything seems to be in pristine condition. BEWARE – the Kantine Restaurant. As we arrived late on the Friday night decided to stay in and eat at the hotel restaurant, big mistake. The small portions looked very nice but the taste was something else, we had three different dishes and they were all unpalatable.
