The stuffed mushrooms, I thought my husband was going to be sick, they tasted that horrible. All for the grand total of 93.00 Euros which did included a drink each, when paying the bill I gave 95.00 Euros and the waiter did not even return with the change. I would recommend you go round the corner to China City that was a lovely meal for half the price. Breakfast was Ok as you must remember you are not in England, very good choice but I am glad we had this included in the price otherwise at 16 Euros each it would have been too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Fortysevensix
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Berlin from Melbourne for a holiday and to watch the World Athletic Championships with the wife and a mate. We booked a one bed apartment (the wife and I) and a studio apartment for our friend. Both the one bed and studio apartment were fanatastic - clean, spacious and well kept. Both had kitchenettes allowing us to self cater if we wished - which we did. Had a ball in Berlin. Location is great - near restaurants, supermarket, the U bahn and the sites, sights and sounds of East Berlin. Booked through Hotels.com and got a terrific rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Good Service”
Reviews.Author: MattGr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 313, one of many rooms available with a balcony, a feature we always find very nice. The front desk staff was very helpful, and knew the answer to every question or request we had. The rooms were spacious and quiet. Comfortable beds and furniture. The air conditioning was a bit weak.

Reviews.Title: “Adina-is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EAAN
Reviews.Content: The Adina Apartment Hotel was very nice with a professional staff. We stayed in an apartment and was perfect for our stay along with being quiet and comfortable. Everything was perfect with the facility and their staff! We did book inside parking but there seemed to be ample outside parking too. The location is fine and safe however keeping in mind the area is going through changes and will take sometime with a city that has a 60 billion debt, Adina's location in the east is close to the major historical sights and culture events, quite easy to move around the city this location. I might add that our reservations were made only a few weeks ahead of time and Adina was extremely flexible with our departure date. We had reserved for three nights and could not decide on a fourth night but they understood and kept the option open to us. There were no issues with reservations, very organized and cooperative and helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel as we do travel extensively, must add this is one of the nicer hotels we stayed and like the apartment alternative!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: ozzgirl102
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel six months ago in Feb 09 as valentine's present for b/friend. Aug w/e was our birthday w/e. Arrived at Adina to book in to be told they had given our room to someone else. They had a couple turn up to a wedding but they had not booked a room so they gave them ours! When we complained, Simone shrugged her shoulders and said 'it's common practice to do this'. Well it's not common practice in my book. Despite complaints that they'd had my money since feb for the booking she wasn't going to budge. She booked us into another hotel which did not have the amenities that I had booked originally. This was on the understanding that we would come back to the Adina the next eve. Next day we arrive to book in to be told they have given our room away YET AGAIN!! No more ms nice guy! Simone was not there (surprise!) so we were put on to another woman (Carol). She was not going to find us a room in the hotel either. I was distraught. This had been booked for SIX MONTHS; it was a valentine's present and was booked for our birthday weekend. In the end she booked us into The Regent for the last two days of our stay. We had wasted precious time on something we should not have had to endure with staff who could not have cared less. Do not trust this hotel with your booking; you may turn up to be told they have given your room away!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels On My Trip”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tops for amount of room, value and designer look. Hotel (really apartments) look fairly new and all have washing machines (except studio). The location is not bad, which is two blocks from U train station and a few blocks from the shopping/restaurant area. They even have a small indoor pool/gym in the basement. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Obie271
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in a two bedroom suite for a very reasonable rate. Loved the bountiful and delicious breakfast buffet (included), the clean and sleek contemporary decor, comfortable beds, friendly and helpful staff, washer/dryer, great location... Everything was as promised on the website. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happinessispurple
Reviews.Content: Hotel was amazing! Staff very friendly. Managed to check in early with no extra charge. Lidl right across the street so able to stock up fridge and cupboards with supplies, to cut costs. Excellent location, 2 min walk from S Bahn. Me and my friend, both female early 20's felt perfectly safe coming and going from hotel. even in the wee hours! Rooms where huge! Come with dishwasher, washing maching and tumble dryer. We went to the pool, and sauna a couple times and was always very quiet and very clean. Hotel was nice and quiet at night. Happy at bar 5:30-7. :D

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TDmize
Reviews.Content: The location is in what seems to be an industrial type area. Its strange to describe, but it is exactly like previous reviews, the neighborhood doesn’t look great, but it has a safe feel to it. There is a ‘Lidl’ (supermarket) on street north of the hotel entrance. We had a studio room, it was simply amazing. It had everything from a washer/dryer, nice bathroom, two flat screen tv’s, a full kitchenette (two burners, microwave/oven, fridge and dishwasher. Unless you can understand German, please ask the front desk how to use the washer/dryer, trust me on this one. The washer/dryers there take quite a bit longer than any washer/dryer that I have used in the US. The front desk was VERY helpful with all questions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saints220
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay in a one bedroom apartment. The suite have everything we needed including a washing machine and drier. Although we did have a dishwasher, we didnt cook much in the apartment and washed up our few dishes. Washing up liquid etc was supplied. Situated in a very central location with a choice of 3 U Bahn stations within a couple of minutes walk. Watch out for over zealous ticket inspectors on the U Bahn. We were frog marched of the train when they suspected we had the wrong ticket, just about the be issued with a forty euro fine each, when they realised we had the correct ticket. Just said "Ok, you can go"! No apology offered. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful, and spoke good english, which was welcome. Even tried very hard to get my husband a ticket for a sold out football match - Thank you Marcel. Good leisure facilites, with a reasonable sized pool, that was rarely busy. All in all a great place to stay, with plenty room to chill out after tramping the streets of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Modern room in great location”
Reviews.Author: HMG2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio apartment which was excellent and consisted of a kitchenette (double hob, kettle, fridge and all necessary cutlery, pots etc) bathroom with shower, sofa and 2 plasma TV screens (one in sleeping area and one in living area!). The room was modern, clean and finished to a high standard. The bed was extremely comfortable, perfect after a long day exploring the many sights Berlin has to offer. Stadmitte U-Bahn and Spittelmarkt U-Bahn are very close to the apartment, but | would recommend printing a street map to help when you arrive, we were ill prepared and ended up getting a taxi round the corner! The swimming pool was very quiet and clean, as was the jacuzzi and sauna. I thoroughly recommend this hotel and would use it again on my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Reckless-In-Forks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in a studio apartment with twin beds in July 09. The hotel is farly new and well kept. The location is great. It is on a residential street which looks a little drab because it is full of old apartment tower blocks and is not well lit, but it is quiet and we felt completely safe even late at night. Checkpoint Charlie is only a couple of blocks away, there are two U-Bahn stations within five minutes walk and Unter den Linden is about 15 minutes away. The room itself was lovely and spotless, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom clean with a great shower, and there was plenty of wardrobe space. The kitchenette was small with just a small sink, fridge, kettle, toaster and microwave. Plenty of crockery and cutlery was provided. It would be great if they could also provide one of those plug-in portable two ring hobs or hotplates as well. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and all spoke perfect English. There is a Lidl supermarket one minute walk away on Leipziger Strasse but I would recommend the Kaiser’s supermarket as a better alternative for good, fresh produce just a few minutes further along Leipziger Strasse near the corner of Friedrich Strasse. We got our room on sale (just 65 Euros per night) so this was excellent value, but even at full price I think Adina is well worth it. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again or in another Adina property elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Special and price + happy surprise”
Reviews.Author: jone
Reviews.Content: When we booked a room in Adina, we didn't really wait anything very special (we did get a special reduce price). But oh my! The Adina was amazing! Right away on the check in we did get a feeling that we were in a nice hotel. And then when we did open our room's door we were amazed: The kitchen with dish washer, micro/oven... The "livingroom" with a flat tv + bedroom with also a flat tv. And bathroom with a lovely shower and washing machine + drum dryer! And everything was so clean. Only "minus" from the breakfast. It wasn't very good for vegetarian needs... But it was ok (there were buns/bread, yoghurt, fruits, juices...). So not a really big issue even there ;) And the location was very good. Short trip to EVERYWHERE :) Would love to stay there again, and again...and again :)

Reviews.Title: “Supassed expectations. Great hotel. No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: awaygray
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Centrally located. Good litle pool, sauna, and gym. As apartment had good 'living space' with fridge, toaster, etc. All new and well designed also. Due to rain was able to use the dryer\washer in the bathroom too - bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - will always come back”
Reviews.Author: prztz
Reviews.Content: Superb room - big, big, big! Good service, very good Kantine restaurant, great relaxing swimming pool. Good location as well. It will be even better on Spring 2010 when they release Adina at Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “super room, excellent location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Lyons1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia, using the reviews on the Tripadvisor website and it to meet my expectations and more! I would like to say a Big Thank You to all the reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: urimland
Reviews.Content: Things I liked: Great location. Rooms are amazing: big, clean, pretty. Modern appliances - my room had a washer and a drier, a mini-fridge, stove, microwave. Staff is incredibly nice and helpful. Indoor pool, gym and jacuzzi. Everything seems to be in pristine condition. Things I would have liked: A few more English channels on the TV, bigger blankets. Note: The bathtub (in my room at least) is set quite high. Doesn't seem too friendly to elderly folk.

Reviews.Title: “Seems living in your own apartment in the center of Berlin!!”
Reviews.Author: Ckart
Reviews.Content: We book this apartment hotel in a very attractive price, based on the reviews of trip advisor travelers and I have to admit that it was just what we expected!! Adina is a new Hotel with comfortable, We stay for five nights in a very clean and well decorated studio apartment, with big bed, refrigerator, electric burners, a microwave, two flat-screen TV’s, kitchen and living area, large shower, and our stay was so quite and calm. To tell the truth we feel like living in our apartment in the centre of an extraordinary city (Berlin). Hotel is located in the borders of Mitte near Stadmitte station (700m) and is easy to get there from the airport in 40 minutes using a Bus and with only one change of metro. Although the neighbor seems a little solitary - dark at night, but never felt unsafe - it is so closed to the center (Mitte) and the sightseeing (Alexanderplatz, Checkpoint Charlie, Holocaust Memorial, Reichstag, Gendarmenmarkt, Museuminse) that it is really a very good located. The hotel courtyard, rest rooms and other public areas are stylish and welcoming but the swimming pool in the basement is too small (rather for children) and we felt rather uncomfortable over there. The staff was friendly, diacritical and spoke very good english. I have to complain because I emailed the hotel and received no response. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant that it seems very expensive (We ask for a bottle of natural water and they charged 7 euros!!) and there so many high class restaurants in the center of Berlin. In any way, we do recommend this hotel to the other travelers!!

Reviews.Title: “It deserves its high rating”
Reviews.Author: Winterpeg1Winnipeg
Reviews.Content: We booked the Adina on Expedia.ca and got a great deal. We opted for the breakfast included and it was a wise choice. Everything about the place far exceeded our expectations. The grocery store/bakery across the road was great. We were a bit nervous about booking in the mitte area but it was perfect. Our only concern is that the general public will catch onto this great little place and then the prices will go up. Book it and relax. It's a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Why stay in a hotel when you can stay in an apartment hotel?”
Reviews.Author: funkyflemmer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just marvellous with a perfect location to explore Berlin. Rooms are sooo big and welcoming. Just stunning! I'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, great facilities, well located”
Reviews.Author: bobrat
Reviews.Content: The apartment was ready by the time we arrived (11:00am). Very clean and spacious. The children (6yrs and 8ys) did not want to leave except to use the swimming pool in the basement. Persuaded out by Legoland, Fat Bike Tours, zoo, and Technology Museum. Internet access from room reasonably priced (about 3.5 Euros for 3 hours), or can access www free from the computer in the hotel lobby. Mini-bar and restaurant too expensive for us, but soon found Lidl (about 50m away -- walk through the car park in front of the main entrance, then turn left). Apartment has a washing mashine and tumble drier in bathroom so no need to take dirty laundry home.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could comment properly on this hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: lollipopshoes
Reviews.Content: ... but when we arrived we were told that a conference party had turned up with more people than expected so they didn't have a room for us. Whilst the reception staff were apologetic and had arranged a room for us at another hotel and paid for a taxi to get us there I was still a little annoyed as I had booked this hotel specifically because it had been recommended by friends and we had planned our weekend around being in this location. I had also booked it through Expedia and paid up front months ago, so I did expect them to have a room for us!

Reviews.Title: “The service is poor and unprofessional - Got electrocuted !!!”
Reviews.Author: Route99
Reviews.Content: Beside the good location and also cleanliness of the hotel, the service IS really POOR. I got almost electrocuted while trying to plug my European Iphone charger to the wall. The whole living room electricity blew up, as well as the cahrger ! The charger was working previously in the bedroom. The front desk took 36hours to put the electricity back in the room. They did not give ANY kind of customer gesture or so. They do NOT return call when trying to call for complaints (of course). This is not the standard I expect from a great hotel, where customer must be the central piece ! Who cares where the electrical issue comes from, when this happens to your hotel ! you deal with it the right way !

Reviews.Title: “Studio rooms great value”
Reviews.Author: mandiecandie5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio room on the 5th floor. It was a great size for two adults and everything about it was modern and fresh. The nicely tiled bathroom had an excellent shower. The hotel courtyard and other public areas are stylish and welcoming. The hotel bar offers a great happy hour everyday from 5:30-7pm and 11-12am with all drinks (exept champagne) 50%! Location was great being very close to the Stadmitte U station which connects to everything. There is a "Spar" (mini grocery store) around the corner from the hotel, closed Sundays. Checkpoint Charlie & Topography of Terror are under a 10 minute walk away. Be sure to enjoy the pool, hot tub and sauna all very high quality! Towels are plentiful down there. Perfect after a long day of sightseeing. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveller009
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Adina at 9am not expecting to be able to get a room that early. They didn't have any studio apartments available at that time (which we had booked) and instead upgraded us to a 1 bedroom apartment. It was beautiful and just what we needed after 3 weeks of hotel rooms. It was large with wonderful views. It is situated just near Checkpoint Charlie and close to the underground and all other sights. It came complete with a washing machine and dryer and dishwasher. It was so good to have a kitchen so that we didn't need to eat out. We paid $150AUD per night - an absolute bargain for such a new and central hotel apartment.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves its high rating!”
Reviews.Author: Basiluzzo
Reviews.Content: Cleam, comfortable, stylish - we loved this place! We booked on the hotel website for a great rate that included full breakfast. The hotel is on a quiet street and walkable to major sights - Potsdamer Platz, Alexanderplatz, Checkpoint Charlie, Holocaust Memorial, Reichstag, Gendarmenmarkt, Museuminsel, etc. It's very near two central subway lines, the U2 and U6, for a quick ride to the shopping in Charlottenburg, as well as the dining and charm of a stroll in Prenzlauer Berg. We spent a week getting to know Berlin and thought this hotel was a gem. Our studio apartment room even had full laundry and a complete kitchenette. The only drawback was no free wifi, but that doesn't seem to be common in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Look forward to staying there again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmiB29
Reviews.Content: The Adina is one of the modern/clean hotels we have stayed in. I read a number of reveiws on the hotel before our stay and have to agree with all the positive comments. Our room was a really good size, high ceiling and huge windows over looking the courtyard, we had a small kitchen area, dining area, large wardrobe, perfect size bathroom and safe. Our room was made up everyday whilst we were out sight seeing and returned to sweets/chocolates on our pillows. The staff were very friendly and spoke very good english. Breakfast was also very good, wide selection to choose from. This was our first trip to Berlin ans when we go for our 2nd we will definetly stay at the Adina. The hotel is really close to Checkpoint Charlie, a section of the remaining wall and starbucks. If like us you get the train from the airport the closest tube station is Stadtmitte. Look out for the Blue overland water pipes, they will lead you to the hotel and you'll walk past a Spar (corner shop) on your way if you need supplies. We had a fantastic evening at "Maximilian's" great food, great beer and great service!! not to mention great price

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: Larcs
Reviews.Content: we had a courtyard suite which had patio decking accessible from the room, which was equipped with every self cater facility you could wish for, neatly stored away. Consequently there was no bath but a small shower. everything was clean and room serviced excellently. Desk staff helpful and bar staff cheerful. Located not far from checkpoint charlie and unter den linden walkable. There are 3 u-bahn stations nearby (betwen 300 and 700 yards away).

Reviews.Title: “When visiting Berlin, the Adina is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FatherTime99
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the only three negative comments that I can think of. 1. The street where the hotel is located is dark at night, but I never felt unsafe. 2. The hotel-booking page may be what Europeans expect but I found it too difficult to use and ultimately chose a different booking site. 3. I emailed the hotel twice and received no response. Now that that is out of the way, let me give you a few of the positives. The hotel is new and spotless. All common areas that we came in contact with, including the restaurant, lobby, restroom, and courtyard, were very well maintained. I booked what is called a studio room, which includes a refrigerator, a couple of electric burners, a microwave and necessary utensils. With the exception of the refrigerator, we used none of these. One might classify the room as ultra modern but it is functionally well designed and laid out. There were two flat-screen TV’s. The bathroom was very efficient, with no tub but a large shower. The bed was hard, as I like it, and comfortable. The room was quite well insulated from outside road noise. When in use, the air conditioning and heat were virtually silent. In short, I was very pleased with the room. So, by now you have figured that I enjoyed the physical layout of the hotel. What made the Adena very special for us were the employees. We checked in rather early and were greeted pleasantly and immediately given our room rather than being told that check-in was not until later in the day. When we asked for directions, the staff was very patient and helpful. We asked for a particular restaurant (I would add that if you eat nowhere else in Berlin that you eat at one of Hasir’s restaurants) and were given excellent directions. The restaurant staff and housekeeping staff were equally cordial and efficient. I was disappointed that the Adina had no nightlife of any sort or if it did, it came to an end before we returned to the hotel. Fear not, around the corner is the Marriott Courtyard, where late night meals and drinks were being served. The hotel is located very close to a number of underground stops, the closest being Stadmite. There are a number of shops and restaurants within very easy walking distance. So that you may better judge this review let me tell you a bit about myself. I travel for a living and have flown almost 7 million miles. Although not often, I have stayed at 5 star hotels in cities from Sydney to London, Rome, New York and San Francisco. Most of the time, when I travel in the US, I stay at either Marriott or Hilton properties. I would liken the Adina to a newer Marriott Courtyard or a Hilton Suites hotel in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: GordonandMichael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adina in Berlin in April for a 5-day City break. We arrived at 12 noon and our room was ready - this was ahead of the recommended 2pm check in. Check in was smooth and efficient. We had a corner room on the 2nd floor overlooking the inner courtyard. This made the room very quiet and we didn't even hear anyone else in the hotel or outside. If it hadn't been for the people at breakfast, we thought we were on our own. The room was large with a separate lounge/kitchen area and a bedroom. The hotel felt very new and it is well decorated in contempory colours. We also arranged for a late checkout at 12 noon - made the last breakfast more relaxed. Breakfast was great, with lots of choices of fruits, breads and cheeses as well as bacon and eggs. We ate in the hotel restaurant one night and had some great soup, beer and wine. We did try out the pool but it was full of children so not what we call relaxing. On the whole, an excellent hotel. Michael and Gordon

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rosher_9
Reviews.Content: A perfect spot from which to explore Berlin wthin walking distance of main sights and transport links. Initially we were a bit reluctant when we saw the surrounding communist blocks but once inside we were very impressed. Helpful staff, clean and comfortable. We didn't use kitchenette but would be useful if you wanted to save a bit of dosh. The pool and sauna were a nice extra (although we were informed that Germans don't wear swimming costumes in the Sauna unlike us Brits so beware!). Did not eat at restaurant so cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tokkie33
Reviews.Content: The Adina Hotel is without any doubt a very good hotel. The rooms are very spacious and clean. Also very quiet. It seemed like we were the only people staying in the hotel. The staff is friendly and very helpful. As the Adina is not too expensive, it's every euro well spent. In the basement there's a swimming pool & a nice jacuzzi. Towels are on the house. The Kraussenstrasse is an old (Eastberlin)street and you don't expect such a tremendous hotel over there. In the evening, the street is indeed a bit dark, but we never felt uncomfortable. The Adina is just a 3 minute walk away from U-bahn-stations Stadtmitte & Spittelmarkt. We didn't use the breakfast, but nearby are enough coffeeshops (Einstein Kaffee, Starbucks,...). I would highly recommend the Adina Hotel to everyone who's planning a trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mynameisalwaystaken
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and loved it. Whilst on a quiet and dreary looking street the rooms were great (studio apartment almost as big as my flat), the swimming pool and gym were excellent and we had a wonderful peaceful time here. Staff were very helpful. For the attractions that we wanted to see, the hotel was right in the heart of things. The tube stop to the airport was a 5 minute walk away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to staying in their properties in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: DanEavesFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my son - upgraded to one bedroom apartment on arrival. The lounge area was huge with a well equipped kitchen - useful with a fussy 12 year old to feed. Has to be the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in for sleeping - didn't hear any noise from other rooms and as on a residential road there's no traffic noise. Staff were really helpful but not intrusive. Would stay there again as was in an excellent location for seeing the majority of the sights. TRAVEL INFO - To get to the hotel from Tegel Airport just take bus 128 (from outside terminal) to Kurt Schumacher Platz (about 6 stops) then U-bahn towards Alt-Mariendorf for 12 stops to Stadtmitte. (takes about 30 minutes total) Hotel is then only a 10 minute walk max.

Reviews.Title: “Rated very highly”
Reviews.Author: slick_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 005 which is a studio room on the ground floor on the courtyard. Great room with all the amenities that we needed and at a fantastic price. All the staff we dealt with spoke english too which was an added bonus. Kitchen was well stocked and being 2 minutes from Lidl meant we could eat cheap.Location is about 2 minutes walk to check point charlie and 10 minutes up to Unter den Linden so we were happy with that. Berlin itself was more industrial than I thought it would be but if I were ever to go back I'd definately look at going back to the Adina apartments

Reviews.Title: “cracking hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghKris
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in berlin. The Adina Hotel was ideal for our visit.The large lounge area with the modern kitchen was a godsend. Very helpful staff and a pretty good restaurant. Located between two underground stations, makes travelling across Berlin easy and stress free.The area is going through some major redevelopment but this should not put you off staying here.Within 2 minutes of local shops (lidl,wich also has a bakery and a chemist next door) but not much in the way of bars etc.You will have to travel into the centre to find these but it is only a couple of stops on the tube.We had a great week here, idaelly located to see the best that Berlin has to offer. Would highly recommend the Adina Hotel to anyone spending a week or more.

Reviews.Title: “Just another rave review”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early December.....and can only confirm all the great things said in the other reviews! Great rooms,facilities,staff,attention,helpfulness. The location is very convenient, if run down. However,to me it just highlights Berlin's journey in the last 19 years.......so many of the people you will see in the streets by the hotel will have grown up in East Berlin in the massive blocks of apartments...and they will have had to adjust to "western" ways. They must scratch their heads when they walk down Friedrichstrasse and its high end shops! So, I recommend the location even more...if you are interested in seeing some modern history

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: blondieireland1
Reviews.Content: southern ilreland,oct 2008, just back from a 3 night stay at adina apartment hotel berlin.our stay here was absolutely superb.on arrival hotel was very warm+ inviting.absolutely beautiful decore+wlth it being a cold berlin night,beautiful big + warm glowing fire welcomed you to the lobby.very secure we felt as to access your room you had to use your swipe card in order to access lifts to your room,straight away sence of security from intruders.rooms or apartments were beautifully decorated + spotlessly clean(new hotel since 07)straight away attracted to flat screen t.v mounted on sitting room wall,not 1 but a second 1 mounted on bedroom wall,which made you feel even more special because as you switched it on it welcomed you by name for your stay.lovely touch.room catered for everything from sewing kit to bottle openers ect,anything you basically forgot or needed was provided from or could be optained.as we only reserved room only found it had an lidyl just across carpark opposite + turn left.very convienient.staff were very friendly,polite+helpful + curtious.pool cold but we made the mistake of going into jacussi 1st so pool seemed freezing after.tip,pool 1st.gym sauna + jacussi fab.everywhere easily accessed from hotel+it`s very central.only difficulty we had when we arrived was street signs not brill near station so found it hard to find.if you come off bus or station,walk straight down the road,in the opposite direction to the traffic + keep walking on the left hand footpath till u come to chinese restaurant on corner,turn left here,adina just at the end of short street.definitely recommend this hotel to everybody.would be hard to beat.thanks adina for an unforgetable stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sr55
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Adina and would certainly use it again if we return to Berlin. Comfortable, clean, modern, quiet and well-equipped. And - unusually - not too hot (as most hotel rooms seem to be these days). Nice to have somewhere to cook if you want a change from eating out. Well located for the city centre - walking, or Stadtmitte U-bahn is at the end of the street

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buzz_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great, stayed 3 nights, large new room with kitchen facilities. Located on a quiet street very close to checkpoint charlie and U bahn station. Highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault!”
Reviews.Author: brighton_max
Reviews.Content: I actually work for a hotel booking site and travel a lot and I have to say this is one of the nciest hotels I've stayed in. Great facilities, really friendly staff, amazing room with great small touches, fully equipped kitchen, balcony, plasma screens in every room, lovely pool and jacuzzi as well. If I really had to find a fault, i'd say the street it is on isn't particularly great but i'll only say that if im forced to find a down side! We were there for a travel conference during the transport strike and they put a free shuttle bus on to the conference centre and after the first day left a conference 'recovery pack' in our room with free wine, pain killers, hand cream, energy tablets...everything you need after a day at a conference. They also had their opening party that night (hotel is only a few months old) with free food and drinks for all guests. Obviously they were well aware that most guests were in the travel industry those few days so they pulled out all the stops but still, who am i to complain! Overall, a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a wonderful gem”
Reviews.Author: pghpeople
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and wished we would have booked the whole week--instead of moving to Park Inn Alex. Got there early from our flight and was met with the most gracious reception and was told our room was ready and we could check in. Beautiful cozy lobby with quite areas and a wonderful fireplace. Also a computer is available gratis in the lobby. Our room was just spectacular. Very chic, very comfortable and very quiet. The kitchen had everything you needed and also provided dish soap and tabs. It was nice having to buy only our food. Loved the closet with drawers and the bathroom was very nicely appointed. The best part was the washer and dryer. We were able to pack much more lightly. They also provided laundry tabs too! Everyone we had contact with was well trained,kind and very friendly. Loved the location short walk to Spittlemarkt and walkable to Stadtmitt which comes in handy. The market and the drugstore are right across the street. Got a great rate of 103e a night. I wish this chain was in more locations besides Germany--it would be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments - better than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: lost-artist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for 3 nights and it was brilliant. Well designed modern apartments built to the usual excellent German standards. We had a studio, and had everything we needed. The staff are very friendly and helpful and speak perfect English. The location is good in the old East Berlin - not the prettiest - as there is a lot of development going on, but it felt very safe and is only 5 mins from the nearest tube station - Spittlemarkt, or Stadtmitte about 10 minutes. There is a Lidl supermarket 1 minute away if you want to self-cater. The studios have fridges, microwaves, hotplates and a dishwasher, washing machine and tumble drier. In addition the maid cleans the room everyday and does the washing up! Our rooms faced the inner courtyard which made them a little dark, but very quiet, no street noise at all. Other apartments face the street and may be a bit noisier. Having said that its a quiet street. Wireless internet cost about 40p per hour, but we had to buy a 12 hour card - get this from reception. We will be going back because 3 days wasn't enough to see everything, and we will stay at Adina.

Reviews.Title: “Well designed accommodation in an improving area”
Reviews.Author: RS59
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night a couple of months after they opened. These apartments are very well designed. Our accommodation consisted of a bedroom plus good sized sitting/ eating/ kitchen area. The kitchen was very well equipped with microwave, fan oven and cooking rings. The design was very attractive with an Australian theme (aboriginal art and earthy colours). Staff were friendly and efficient. The immediate area is probably best described as improving, on one side is a derelict building on the other is a new block with a Marriott Courtyard. There is Lidl discount store and bakery in an old shopping mall 200m away and it felt a bit weird going from the designer hotel to run down mall for supplies and back again. We did an an interesting walk along Zimmerstrasse, two blocks away, which took us to Checkpoint Charlie then past a preserved section of the Berlin Wall to Potsdamer Platz. The leisure facilities are good with a 17m pool, although the water was cold so you had to keep moving, and a separate whirlpool and sauna. There is a fitness room but no sitting area. Overall we enjoyed our stay very much and one night was too short to fully benefit from everything this apartment hotel provided.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, comfortable, quiet. We loved Adina!”
Reviews.Author: susuris
Reviews.Content: The Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin is located in the historic Mitte district and offers 125 one and two bedroom apartments and studio rooms. The hotel is brand new, opened mid December 2007. One of the city’s premier tourist attractions Checkpoint Charlie and the nearby underground station (Spittelmarkt, U-bahn line U2) are only five minutes away on foot. We stayed there for 3 days / 2 nights in a one bedroom apartment featuring a separate lounge and dining area, fully equipped kitchen with oven, stovetop, microwave, dishwasher and fridge/freezer, tea / coffee making facilities, mini bar, bathroom with bath / shower, individual washing machine and dryer, 2 hairdryers, iron & ironing board, there was an in room safe in the bedroom closet, 2 color TVs with select cable channels and in-house movies, individually controlled heating / cooling etc. The hotel also offers room service, dry cleaning and laundry service, baby sitting service and pantry service. Underground parking is available if you travel by car (charges apply). We booked via hotel website (check out [--]) and later on got a very nice e-mail back with detailed directions on how to get to the hotel from Tegel airport. Our room had a courtyard view and was on the 5th floor. The hotel also has a restaurant and café on site but we didn’t try it so no comments there, although it looked lovely and inviting in the evenings upon our return with candles flickering on the tables everywhere – even in the lobby – very romantic. Overall the hotel was quiet, clean and comfortable. It was nice to get away from the noisy city centre after a long day full of tourist must-sees and just get good nights sleep (although we did much more!). There’s a fitness centre in the basement with sauna, pool, bubble bath and gym which can be used by all hotel guests (included in accommodation price). At the end of the first day we returned to our hotel apartment and relaxed in the sauna and bubble bath, and even took a dip in the swimming pool. Afterwards we watched an in-house movie (the price is 10 Euros per movie) and hit the bed (which was quite comfortable I must say; additional pillows, blankets and duvets are available as well as special pillows and duvets for allergic people). On the second night I was too tired to leave the room (apparently shopping can be very tiring!) so I just stayed in and took a long soothing bath in the brand new and perfectly clean bathroom, sipping cool German Riesling and planning our last day activities while my husband worked out in fitness centre… He said it was OK. There's no reason not to believe him as the gym is brand new and fully equiped, I saw it myself. We really loved staying at Adina. Had we taken our 2yrs old daughter with us, it’d still have been as good. But we wanted a little romantic break from home so not this time :) If you choose to stay at Adina, you won’t regret it. Thumbs up!
